commit_message:
Make Devref for LBaaS v2 API[WIP]

Change-Id: I3937c9eb07d963afc2c4a4585ecc550236cdb166
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/79/302079/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============== API Operations ============== This section explains specific API operations. For ideas relevant to all API operations, see the "General API Information" chapter. Load Balancers ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Use the following APIs to manage Load Balancer resources: +--------+----------------------------------------------+ | Verb | URI | +========+==============================================+ |GET | /lbaas/loadbalancers/ | +--------+----------------------------------------------+ |GET | /lbaas/loadbalancers/loadbalancer_id | +--------+----------------------------------------------+ |POST | /lbaas/loadbalancers | +--------+----------------------------------------------+ |PUT | /lbaas/loadbalancers/loadbalancer_id | +--------+----------------------------------------------+ |DELETE | /lbaas/loadbalancers/loadbalancer_id | +--------+----------------------------------------------+ |GET | /lbaas/loadbalancers/loadbalancer_id/statuses| +--------+----------------------------------------------+ |GET | /lbaas/loadbalancers/loadbalancer_id/stats | +--------+----------------------------------------------+ List all Load Balancers ----------------------- +------+---------------------+ |Verb | URI | +======+=====================+ |GET |/lbaas/loadbalancers/| +------+---------------------+ **Normal Response Code(s):** 200 **Error Response Code(s):** - 401 (Unauthorized) - 500 (Internal server error) - 503 (Service Unavailable) This operation returns the list of all load balancers associated with your tenant account. This operation does not require a request body. This operation returns a response body. It returns a (potentially empty) list, each element in the list is a Load Balancer that can contain the following attributes: - id - tenant_id - name - description - vip_subnet_id - vip_address - admin_state_up - listeners - provisioning_status - operating_status **Example . List all Load Balancers** JSON Request: :: GET /lbaas/loadbalancers Host: lbaas-service.cloudX.com:8651 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token:887665443383838 JSON Response: :: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json { "loadbalancers": [ { "description": "simple lb", "admin_state_up": true, "tenant_id": "1a3e005cf9ce40308c900bcb08e5320c", "provisioning_status": "ACTIVE", "listeners": [ ], "vip_address": "10.0.0.2", "vip_subnet_id": "013d3059-87a4-45a5-91e9-d721068ae0b2", "id": "a9729389-6147-41a3-ab22-a24aed8692b2", "operating_status": "ONLINE", "name": "loadbalancer1" } ] } Retrieve a specific Load Balancer --------------------------------- +------+------------------------------------+ |Verb | URI | +======+====================================+ |GET |/lbaas/loadbalancers/loadbalancer_id| +------+------------------------------------+ *Normal Response Code(s):* 200 *Error Response Code(s):* - 401 (Unauthorized) - 403 (Forbidden) - 404 (Not Found) - 409 (Conflict) - 413 (Over limit) - 500 (Internal server error) - 503 (Service Unavailable) This operation returns a Load Balancer object identified by loadbalancer_id. If the user is not an admin, and the Load Balancer object doesn't belong to her tenant account, she would receive a 403 (Forbidden) error. This operation does not require a request body. This operation returns a response body. On success, the returned element is a Load Balancer that can contain the following attributes: - id - tenant_id - name - description - vip_subnet_id - vip_address - admin_state_up - listeners - provisioning_status - operating_status **Example . Retrieve a Load Balancer's details:** JSON Request: :: GET /lbaas/loadbalancers/36e08a3e-a78f-4b40-a229-1e7e23eee1ab Host: lbaas-service.cloudX.com:8651 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token:887665443383838 JSON Response: :: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json { "loadbalancer": { "description": "simple lb", "admin_state_up": true, "tenant_id": "1a3e005cf9ce40308c900bcb08e5320c", "provisioning_status": "ACTIVE", "listeners": [ ], "vip_address": "10.0.0.2", "vip_subnet_id": "013d3059-87a4-45a5-91e9-d721068ae0b2", "id": "a9729389-6147-41a3-ab22-a24aed8692b2", "operating_status": "ONLINE", "name": "loadbalancer1" } } Create a Load Balancer ---------------------- +------+----------------------+ |Verb | URI | +======+======================+ |POST | /lbaas/loadbalancers| +------+----------------------+ **Normal Response Code(s):** 201 **Error Response Code(s):** - 401 (Unauthorized) - 404 (Not Found) - 409 (Conflict) - 413 (Over limit) - 500 (Internal server error) - 503 (Service Unavailable) This operation provisions a new Load Balancer based on the configuration defined in the request object. Once the request is validated and progress has started on the provisioning process, a response object will be returned. The object will contain a unique identifier and the status of provisioning the Load Balancer. The provisioning_status of the Load Balancer in the response can take one of the following values: ACTIVE, PENDING_CREATE or ERROR. If the status returned is set to "PENDING_CREATE", then using the identifier of the Load Balancer, the caller can check on the progress of the provisioning operation by performing a GET on /lbaas/loadbalancers/loadbalancer_id. When the status of the load balancer returned changes to "ACTIVE", then the Load Balancer has been successfully provisioned and is now operational for traffic handling. The caller of this operation must specify at least the following attributes of the Load Balancer: - tenant_id: only required if the caller has an admin role and wants to create a Load Balancer for another tenant. - vip_subnet_id: The network on which to allocate the load balancer's vip address. A tenant can only create load balancer vips on networks authorized by policy (e.g. her own networks or shared/provider networks). Some attributes will receive default values if not specified in the request: - admin_state_up: The default value for this attribute is true. - name: The default value for this attribute will be an empty string. - description: The default value for this attribute will be an empty string. These attributes are optional: - vip_address: if provided, the system will attempt to assign the load balancer's vip address to this. - provider: the name of a valid provider to provision the load balancer. If the request cannot be fulfilled due to insufficient or invalid data, an HTTP 400 (Bad Request) error response will be returned with information regarding the nature of the failure in the body of the response. Failures in the validation process are non-recoverable and require the caller to correct the cause of the failure and POST the request again. Users may configure all documented features of the Load Balancer at creation time by simply providing the additional elements or attributes in the request. Users with an admin role can create Load Balancers on behalf of other tenants by specifying a tenant_id attribute different than their own. **Example: Create a Load Balancer** JSON Request: :: POST /lbaas/loadbalancers Host: lbaas-service.cloudX.com:8651 Content-Type: application/json Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token:887665443383838 { "loadbalancer": { "name": "loadbalancer1", "description": "simple lb", "tenant_id": "b7c1a69e88bf4b21a8148f787aef2081", "vip_subnet_id": "013d3059-87a4-45a5-91e9-d721068ae0b2", "vip_address": "10.0.0.4", "admin_state_up": true } } JSON Response: :: HTTP/1.1 201 Created Content-Type: application/json Content-Length: 213 { "loadbalancer": { "description": "simple lb", "admin_state_up": true, "tenant_id": "b7c1a69e88bf4b21a8148f787aef2081", "provisioning_status": "ACTIVE", "listeners": [], "vip_address": "10.0.0.4", "vip_subnet_id": "013d3059-87a4-45a5-91e9-d721068ae0b2", "id": "a36c20d0-18e9-42ce-88fd-82a35977ee8c", "operating_status": "ONLINE", "name": "loadbalancer1" } } A user can supply a vip_address field if she owns the subnet on which the Load Balancer's VIP will be created. If a vip_address is not specified in the payload, then the LBaaS service will allocate one from the Load Balancer VIP's subnet.

commit_message:
sync_allocations throws DBDuplicatedEntry with postgres HA

When using Galera and two (or more) processes tries to modify
the same records we get a deadlock exception.
Postgres in HA behaves differently, the process that commits
first sees no error, the others get a DBDuplicatedEntry
exception. As already done in Galera case, the solution is to
retry. The transaction will be restarted, the process will get
fresh data and won't try to insert the duplicated entries
anymore.

Change-Id: I7e257f6f2d1db3103e74170b865b184033b495dd
Closes-bug: #1421626

commit_message:
Prevent created multiple gateway ports on same router's gateway

It is supported by "_lock_router" [1]
It uses the updating feature of database to disallow 2 transections
performing concurrently: Two transections will be conflicted because
they update the same row. One transection will be refused

This change adds the "router_hash" attribute in "routers" table

[1] neutron.db.l3_db

Co-Authored-By: Cao Xuan Hoang <HoangCX@vn.fujitsu.com>

Closes-Bug: #1535225

Change-Id: I8fad90a93618b4434827974d0f87a4ff882108c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/64/287564/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class RouterInUse(e.InUse): message = _("Router %(router_id)s is already used")

subject: [l2pop] fix agents failing to create flood flows
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 11:43:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2ce5e920c58b28af04f9d92d4e13835f3b0475bc', 'message': "[l2pop] fix agents failing to create flood flows

When multiple api and rpc workers enabled for neutron-server,
sometimes ovs agents fail to create flood flows to other ovs agents.
Please see bug report for complete description.

In these scenarios, l2pop driver is not notifying agent to create
tunnel ports and flood flows because it is failing to identify
first/last port on agent on that network when multiple workers
simultaneously create/bind/update/delete ports on the agent.

Instead of agent depending on l2pop driver to notify when to create
or delete flood flows to other agents, let agent decide this on their
own. With this change ovs agent will maintain list of ports on other
agent for each network, like below,
lvm.tun_ofports={<agent1>: [<port1_id>, <port20_id>, ..],
                 <agent2>: [<port12_id>, <port4_id>, ..]}

For first port on the list, it creates flood flow to that agent.
When list becomes empty, it deletes flood flow to that agent.

With this approach, when a port create/update/delete happens,
l2pop driver has to notify only about this port to all agents.
Agents will then add this port to their local list.
Agent will ignore any other notifications.
In this new appraoch, new field 'port' added to fdb_entries,
because l2pop will always notify about a single port and can
avoid duplicate entries in fdb.

A new RPC added for agent to get existing network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list and flood entries to other agents
when first port on network(new lvm) on this local agent created(
same happens on agent restarts).

To maintain backword compatility with agents from previous releases,
l2pop driver still notifies about network ports to agent and also
all fdb fields retained.

Closes-bug: #1555600
Change-Id: I6d9d14763c3d4426815fd309a2c80eb8fabd191a
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-06 15:40:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0d39d0d966ea489ff4d6ede06e1b8bf7aa922132', 'message': "[l2pop] fix agents failing to create flood flows

simultaneously create/bind/update/delete ports on the agent.

Instead of agent depending on l2pop driver to notify when to create
or delete flood flows to other agents, let agent decide this on their
own. With this change ovs agent will maintain list of ports on other
agent for each network, like below,
lvm.tun_ofports={<agent1>: [<port1_id>, <port20_id>, ..],
                 <agent2>: [<port12_id>, <port4_id>, ..]}

For first port on the list, it creates flood flow to that agent.
When list becomes empty, it deletes flood flow to that agent.

With this approach, when a port create/update/delete happens,

Agents will then add this port to their local list.

In this new appraoch, new field 'port' added to fdb_entries,
because l2pop will always notify about a single port and can
avoid duplicate entries in fdb.

A new RPC added for agent to get existing network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list and flood entries to other agents
when first port on network(new lvm) on this local agent created(
same happens on agent restarts).

To maintain backword compatility with agents from previous releases,
l2pop driver still notifies about network ports to agent and also
all fdb fields retained.

Closes-bug: #1555600
Change-Id: I6d9d14763c3d4426815fd309a2c80eb8fabd191a
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-06 16:05:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4c872ff4aa72a08af73e10be703e8addb3c4b78d', 'message': '[l2pop] fix agents failing to create flood flows

When multiple api and rpc workers enabled for neutron-server,
sometimes ovs agents fail to create/remove flood flows to other ovs
agents(as l2pop driver is failing to identify first/last port).
Please see bug report for complete description.

Instead of agent depending on l2pop driver to notify when to create
or delete flood flows to other agents, let agent decide this on their
own. With this change ovs agent will maintain list of ports on "other
agent" for "each network", like below,
lvm.tun_ofports={<agent1>: [<port1_id>, <port20_id>, ..],
                 <agent2>: [<port12_id>, <port4_id>, ..]}

For first port on the list, it creates flood flow to that agent.
When list becomes empty, it deletes flood flow to that agent.

With this approach, when a port create/update/delete happens,
l2pop driver has to notify "only current port fdb" to all agents(only
fanout and no cast notification).In this new appraoch, new field 'port'
added to fdb_entries,because l2pop will always notify about a single
port and can avoid duplicate entries in port's fdb.

A new RPC added for agent to get existing network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list and flood entries to other agents
when first port on network(new lvm) on this local agent created(
same happens on agent restarts).

To maintain backword compatility with agents from previous releases,
l2pop driver still notifies about network ports to agent and also
all fdb fields retained.Once this obsolete code is removed, l2pop driver
will be simpler like in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302325/

Need to implement similar changes on linux bridge agent.

Closes-bug: #1555600
Change-Id: I6d9d14763c3d4426815fd309a2c80eb8fabd191a

agent" for "each network", like below,
lvm.tun_ofports={<agent1>: [<port1_id>, <port20_id>, ..],
                 <agent2>: [<port12_id>, <port4_id>, ..]}

For first port on the list, it creates flood flow to that agent.
When list becomes empty, it deletes flood flow to that agent.

With this approach, when a port create/update/delete happens,
l2pop driver has to notify "only current port fdb" to all agents(only
fanout and no cast notification).In this new appraoch, new field 'port'
added to fdb_entries,because l2pop will always notify about a single
port and can avoid duplicate entries in port's fdb.

A new RPC added for agent to get existing network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list and flood entries to other agents
when first port on network(new lvm) on this local agent created(
same happens on agent restarts).

To maintain backword compatility with agents from previous releases,
l2pop driver still notifies about network ports to agent and also
all fdb fields retained.Once this obsolete code is removed, l2pop driver
will be simpler like in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302325/

Need to implement similar changes on linux bridge agent.

Closes-bug: #1555600
Change-Id: I6d9d14763c3d4426815fd309a2c80eb8fabd191a
'}]
commit_message:
[l2pop] fix agents failing to create flood flows

When multiple api and rpc workers enabled for neutron-server,
sometimes ovs agents fail to create/remove flood flows to other ovs
agents(as l2pop driver is failing to identify first/last port).
Please see bug report for complete description.

Instead of agent depending on l2pop driver to notify when to create
or delete flood flows to other agents, let agent decide this on their
own. With this change ovs agent will maintain list of ports on "other
agent" for "each network", like below,
lvm.tun_ofports={<agent1>: [<port1_id>, <port20_id>, ..],
                 <agent2>: [<port12_id>, <port4_id>, ..]}

For first port on the list, it creates flood flow to that agent.
When list becomes empty, it deletes flood flow to that agent.

With this approach, when a port create/update/delete happens,
l2pop driver has to notify "only current port fdb" to all agents(only
fanout and no cast notification).In this new appraoch, new field 'port'
added to fdb_entries,because l2pop will always notify about a single
port and can avoid duplicate entries in port's fdb.

A new RPC added for agent to get existing network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list and flood entries to other agents
when first port on network(new lvm) on this local agent created(
same happens on agent restarts).

To maintain backword compatility with agents from previous releases,
l2pop driver still notifies about network ports to agent and also
all fdb fields retained.Once this obsolete code is removed, l2pop driver
will be simpler like in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302325/

Need to implement similar changes on linux bridge agent.

Closes-bug: #1555600
Change-Id: I6d9d14763c3d4426815fd309a2c80eb8fabd191a

commit_message:
WIP: Make API errors conform to API-WG schema

Just a skeleton for implementing this feature is to help
reviewers understand it easily.

In the patch, only the following 4 aspects are involved.
1. Introduce BaseExceptionMeta into neutron
2. Introduce a wrapper into neutron
3. Enhance wsgi interface to handle Neutron-Common-Error-Format
4. Add wrapper for some APIs (e.g. show())

Change-Id: I41700500b7030a9a5d2e1f0c5f183dba14ef14b3
Depends-On: I996ea1bf1f95548f5fbd7bba19e42e620efd9f67
Co-Authored-By: caosf <caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com>
Related-Bug: #1554869
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/27/302127/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.common import exception_metas com_err_msg = request.is_common_err_msg_format() format_error_message(e, com_err_msg=com_err_msg)) format_error_message(e, com_err_msg=com_err_msg)) new_exc = exception_metas.add_exception_metas( webob.exc.HTTPInternalServerError(msg), 'neutron.api.show.not-found', request_id=request.context.request_id) format_error_message(new_exc, com_err_msg=com_err_msg)) raise new_exc.__class__(**kwargs)def get_exception_data_with_com_err(e): """Extract the information about exceptions with common error format. Neutron client expects exceptions to have 'request_id', 'code', 'status', 'title', 'detail' and 'links' attributes. This information is extracted and converted into a list. :param e: the exception to be reraised :returns: a list with the exception data """ err_data = [meta.to_dict() for meta in e.metas] return err_data def format_error_message(e, com_err_msg=False): """Format the error message. Neutron client supports two styles of error message now: - the old style which is specified by neutron. - the common style which is recommended by API-WG. This interface will format the error message based on the value of 'com_err_msg'. :param e: the exception to be reraised :param common_err_msg: the flag to indicate which style will be extracted :returns: a structured dict with the exception data """ if com_err_msg: return {'errors': get_exception_data_with_com_err(e)} else: return {'NeutronError': get_exception_data(e)}

commit_message:
Check gateway ip when adding router interface on external network

When user setting gateway for a router, need attach to an external
network. Meanwhile user can add a router interface on that external
network, that cause gateway ip conflict in router namespace.

This patch checks gateway ip conflict when adding a router interface
(add by subnet) on an external network.(In some vendor implementation)
Also prohibits adding a router interface on an external network.
(for Neutron native implementation)

Change-Id: Ieda07e3bc04e7337c2e2aad750798d52347dab1b
Closes-Bug: #1539444
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/44/274344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not use stevedore namespase as a prefix for class FQNs

Now FQNs of classes are defined only by entry point names.
For backward compatibility it is still possible to find a class
by name with the io.murano.extensions prefix.

bp plugin-fqn-rename

Change-Id: Id63e58ae7a8ed43611a163f22c4de8dc33312afe

commit_message:
Constrain exception handling in _validate_subnet

Constraining exception handling to the netaddr call in
neutron.api.v2.attributes._validate_subnet prevents exceptions that
may occur on unrelated lines from being unintentionally handled.

Closes-Bug: 1510149

Change-Id: I8678be4d1b7ed7361883c62f4f2008f76a7615c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/68/239468/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except netaddr.core.AddrFormatError: msg = (_("'%(data)s' is not a valid IP subnet") % {'data': data}) except TypeError as e: msg = (_("This is not a valid IP subnet because: %(reason)s") % {'reason': str(e)}) else: return msg else: return
deleted_lines: else: return except Exception: msg = _("'%s' is not a valid IP subnet") % data return msg

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 00:25:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ec87a2fe9f3ccafadb62a6738023aab06d4254f7', 'message': 'DVR: Fix issue of SNAT rule for DVR with floating ip

With current code, there are 2 issues.

1) The prevent snat rule that is added for floating ip will be
cleaned, when restarting the l3 agent. Without this rule, the fixed
ip will be SNATed to floating ip, even if the network request is to

2) The prevent snat rule will not be cleaned, even if the external

the l3 agent can clean these dump rules.

The fix in this patch will handle DVR floating ip nat rules at the
same step to handle nat rules for other routers(legacy router, dvr
edge router)

After the change in [1], the fip nat rules for external port have
been extracted together into a method. Add all rules in that method
in the same step can fix the issue of ping floating ip, but reply
with fixed ip.

commit_message:
DVR: Fix issue of SNAT rule for DVR with floating ip

With current code, there are 2 issues.

1) The prevent snat rule that is added for floating ip will be
cleaned, when restarting the l3 agent. Without this rule, the fixed
ip will be SNATed to floating ip, even if the network request is to
an internal IP.

2) The prevent snat rule will not be cleaned, even if the external
device(rfp device) is deleted. So, when the floating ips are removed
from DVR router, there are still dump rules in iptables. Restarting
the l3 agent can clean these dump rules.

The fix in this patch will handle DVR floating ip nat rules at the
same step to handle nat rules for other routers(legacy router, dvr
edge router)

After the change in [1], the fip nat rules for external port have
been extracted together into a method. Add all rules in that method
in the same step can fix the issue of ping floating ip, but reply
with fixed ip.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286392/

Change-Id: I018232c03f5df2237a11b48ac877793d1cb5c1bf
Closes-Bug: #1549311
Related-Bug: #1462154
(cherry picked from commit 1cea77b0aafbada6cad89a6fe0f5450004aef4e1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/50/296850/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: super(DvrEdgeRouter, self)._handle_router_snat_rules( ex_gw_port, interface_name) # NOTE: DVR adds the jump to float snat via super class, # but that is in the router namespace and not snat.
deleted_lines: # NOTE DVR doesn't add the jump to float snat like the super class.

commit_message:
Prevent KeyError exception when port is missing subnet

This changes tries to avoid stacktraces in logs when
ports is missing subnet, e.g.:

  File "neutron/common/utils.py", line 371, in call
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py", line 946, in process_delete
    self._process_internal_ports(agent.pd)
  File "neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py", line 493, in _process_internal_ports
    for subnet in p['subnets']:
KeyError: 'subnets'

Change-Id: I4048f4ed846ac10ecac31c009e2c7fa281a273e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/18/310318/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for subnet in p.get('subnets', []): for subnet in p.get('subnets', []):
deleted_lines: for subnet in p['subnets']: for subnet in p['subnets']:

commit_message:
setup colorized logging for fullstack tests

This change sets log formatting options for colorizing log
output for neutron logs.

SafeConfigParser is replaced with RawConfigParser to avoid
interpolation errors while parsing the config.

Change-Id: I84701dab4106c9b7d3271a501e87cdfa1b2db61c

commit_message:
Remove the default value of target_tenant in RBAC

Using the default value "None" of the target_tenant to create a
RBAC causes an internal server error. This should be removed.

Change-Id: I7823291dfc15d7d8189e4f05108ac892cb94935c
Related-Bug: #1578997

commit_message:
Add target_tenant as mandatory in RBAC creation

As the default value of target_tenant has been removed, this is
to change the target_tenant into a mandatory argument when
creating RBAC.

Change-Id: Ie5bc2c36d4210e4b5a81dc46da828f647a34c4cd
Depends-On: I7823291dfc15d7d8189e4f05108ac892cb94935c
Related-Bug: #1578997

commit_message:
[l2pop] Remove obsolete code from l2pop driver

In the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291674/ logic to
add/remove flood entries is removed from l2pop driver and implemented
in agent. Still it maintains the redundant obsolete code for backward
compatibility with agents from previous releases. Once all agents are
moved to this approach, then this patch removes the redundant obsolete
code.

Change-Id: I96f20a75efdaa786ca06eb1ecabc210fdfe9aa21

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 OpenStack Foundation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutron.services import provider_configuration as provconf from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import importutils from neutron.callbacks import events from neutron.callbacks import registry from neutron.callbacks import resources from neutron import context LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) FIREWALL_DRIVERS = 'firewall_drivers' class FirewallService(object): """Firewall Service observer.""" def __init__(self): #self.conf = l3_agent.conf registry.subscribe( sync_firewall_zones, resources.ROUTER, events.AFTER_CREATE) registry.subscribe( sync_firewall_zones, resources.ROUTER, events.AFTER_DELETE) registry.subscribe( sync_firewall_zones, resources.ROUTER, events.AFTER_UPDATE) def load_device_drivers(self): """Loads a single device driver for FWaaS.""" device_driver = provconf.get_provider_driver_class( cfg.CONF.fwaas.driver, FIREWALL_DRIVERS) try: driver = importutils.import_object(device_driver) LOG.debug('Loaded FWaaS device driver: %s', device_driver) return driver except ImportError: msg = _('Error importing FWaaS device driver: %s') raise ImportError(msg % device_driver) except ValueError: msg = _('Configuration error - no FWaaS device_driver specified') raise ValueError(msg) def sync_firewall_zones(resource, event, l3_agent, **kwargs): ri = kwargs['router'] ctx = context.Context(None, ri.router['tenant_id']) fw_list = l3_agent.fwplugin_rpc.get_firewalls_for_tenant(ctx) for fw in fw_list: #call driver api directly if (event == events.AFTER_CREATE): l3_agent.create_firewall(ctx, fw, ri) if (event == events.AFTER_UPDATE): l3_agent.update_firewall(ctx, fw, ri) if (event == events.AFTER_DELETE): l3_agent.delete_firewall(ctx, fw, ri)

subject: Preventing duplicated rule on *one* security group in neutron active-active
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-26 06:02:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/545e0ffb3ab9d17c9dbff00be7ade69beeabab80', 'message': 'Preventing duplicated rule on *one* security group in neutron active-active

This change prevents two identical rules when performing concurrent
rule security group creations on same security group
in neutron active-active. It is supported by _lock_security_group [1].
It uses the updating feature of database to disallow 2 transactions
performing concurrently: Two transactions will conflict each other
because they update the same row to the db will discard the last transaction
and Controller.create[2] will catch and retry the "discarded" allocation.

This change adds the "hash" attribute in "securitygroups" table
to enable previous update.

commit_message:
Preventing duplicated rule on *one* security group in neutron active-active

This change prevents two identical rules when performing concurrent
rule security group creations on same security group
in neutron active-active. It is supported by _lock_security_group [1].
It uses the updating feature of database to disallow 2 transactions
performing concurrently: Two transactions will conflict each other
because they update the same row to the db will discard the last transaction
and Controller.create[2] will catch and retry the "discarded" allocation.

This change adds the "hash" attribute in "securitygroups" table
to enable previous update.

[1] neutron.db.securitygroups_db
[2] neutron.api.v2.base

Change-Id: I729b626560da821c7f5212014b73352925c8fe3a
Closes-Bug: #1532696

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """lock security group Revision ID: 6d1c6628518f Revises: 659bf3d90664 Create Date: 2016-01-26 11:49:18.036950 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '6d1c6628518f' down_revision = '659bf3d90664' from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa def upgrade(): op.add_column( 'securitygroups', sa.Column('hash', sa.String(36), nullable=False, server_default=''))

subject: Prevent duplicated CIDRs on *one* Router
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 02:45:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8ab14ca3416a2b4a415f9cdfbb856c5a0b6285ab', 'message': 'This change prevent:
1. Duplicated CIDRs could be added to one router
2. Multiple ports which have duplicated CIDRs are added as
one router's interface

It is supported by "_lock_router" [1]
It uses the updating feature of database to diallow 2 transections
performing concurrently: Two transections will be conflicted because
they update the same row. One transection will be refused

This change adds the "router_hash" attribute in "routers" table

commit_message:
Prevent duplicated CIDRs on *one* Router

This patch set modified to prevent:
1. Duplicated CIDRs could be added to one router
2. Multiple ports which have duplicated CIDRs are added as
one router's interface

It is supported by "_lock_router" [1]
It uses the updating feature of database to disallow 2 transections
performing concurrently: Two transections will be conflicted because
they update the same row. One transection will be refused

This change adds the "router_hash" attribute in "routers" table

[1] neutron.db.l3_db

Co-Authored-By: Cao Xuan Hoang  <HoangCX@vn.fujitsu.com>

Closes-Bug: #1535226
Closes-Bug: #1535549

Change-Id: I41c2006152016bb2610d5e34ae2a73225463641c

commit_message:
[WIP] Functional tests for QoS in LinuxBridge L2 agent

This patch adds support for LinuxBridge agent in functional tests
and adds tests for QoS bandwidth limit rules on LinuxBridge agent.

Change-Id: I2d27ddb7e2915342ef9043c60988e46bd7adc8a0

'ResourcesPullRpcApi.pull').start() self.pull.side_effect = _pull_mock def set_test_qos_rules(self, policy_id, policy_rules): """This function sets the policy test rules to be exposed.""" qos_policy = policy.QosPolicy( context=None, tenant_id=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), id=policy_id, name="Test Policy Name", description="This is a policy for testing purposes", shared=False, rules=policy_rules) qos_policy.obj_reset_changes() self.qos_policies[policy_id] = qos_policy def _create_test_port_dict(self, policy_id=None): port_dict = super(LinuxBridgeAgentQoSExtensionTestFramework, self)._create_test_port_dict() port_dict['qos_policy_id'] = policy_id port_dict['network_qos_policy_id'] = None return port_dict def _get_device_details(self, port, network): dev = super(LinuxBridgeAgentQoSExtensionTestFramework, self)._get_device_details(port, network) dev['qos_policy_id'] = port['qos_policy_id'] return dev def _assert_bandwidth_limit_rule_is_set(self, port, rule): tc = tc_lib.TcCommand(port['vif_name'], self.kernel_hz_config_value) max_rate, burst = tc.get_filters_bw_limits() self.assertEqual(max_rate, rule.max_kbps) self.assertEqual(burst, rule.max_burst_kbps) def _assert_bandwidth_limit_rule_not_set(self, port): tc = tc_lib.TcCommand(port['vif_name'], self.kernel_hz_config_value) max_rate, burst = tc.get_filters_bw_limits() self.assertIsNone(max_rate) self.assertIsNone(burst) def wait_until_bandwidth_limit_rule_applied(self, port, rule): tc = tc_lib.TcCommand(port['vif_name'], self.kernel_hz_config_value) l2_extensions.wait_until_bandwidth_limit_rule_applied( tc, port['vif_name'], rule) def _create_port_with_qos(self): port_dict = self._create_test_port_dict() port_dict['qos_policy_id'] = TEST_POLICY_ID1 self.setup_agent_and_ports([port_dict]) #self.wait_until_ports_state(self.ports, up=True) self.wait_until_bandwidth_limit_rule_applied(port_dict, TEST_BW_LIMIT_RULE_1) return port_dict class TestLinuxBridgeAgentQosExtension( LinuxBridgeAgentQoSExtensionTestFramework): def test_port_creation_with_bandwidth_limit(self): """Make sure bandwidth limit rules are set in low level to ports.""" self.setup_agent_and_ports( port_dicts=self.create_test_ports(amount=1, policy_id=TEST_POLICY_ID1)) #self.wait_until_ports_state(self.ports, up=True) for port in self.ports: self._assert_bandwidth_limit_rule_is_set( port, TEST_BW_LIMIT_RULE_1) def test_port_creation_with_different_bandwidth_limits(self): """Make sure different types of policies end on the right ports.""" port_dicts = self.create_test_ports(amount=3) port_dicts[0]['qos_policy_id'] = TEST_POLICY_ID1 port_dicts[1]['qos_policy_id'] = TEST_POLICY_ID2 self.setup_agent_and_ports(port_dicts) #self.wait_until_ports_state(self.ports, up=True) self._assert_bandwidth_limit_rule_is_set(self.ports[0], TEST_BW_LIMIT_RULE_1) self._assert_bandwidth_limit_rule_is_set(self.ports[1], TEST_BW_LIMIT_RULE_2) self._assert_bandwidth_limit_rule_not_set(self.ports[2]) # def test_simple_port_policy_update(self): # self.setup_agent_and_ports( # port_dicts=self.create_test_ports(amount=1, # policy_id=TEST_POLICY_ID1)) # self.wait_until_ports_state(self.ports, up=True) # self._assert_dscp_marking_rule_is_set(self.ports[0], # TEST_DSCP_MARKING_RULE_1) # policy_copy = copy.deepcopy(self.qos_policies[TEST_POLICY_ID1]) # policy_copy.rules[0].max_kbps = 500 # policy_copy.rules[0].max_burst_kbps = 5 # policy_copy.rules[1].dscp_mark = TEST_DSCP_MARK_2 # consumer_reg.push(resources.QOS_POLICY, policy_copy, events.UPDATED) # self.wait_until_bandwidth_limit_rule_applied(self.ports[0], # policy_copy.rules[0]) # self._assert_bandwidth_limit_rule_is_set(self.ports[0], # policy_copy.rules[0]) # self._assert_dscp_marking_rule_is_set(self.ports[0], # TEST_DSCP_MARKING_RULE_2) # def on given port refreshes all its # rules. # """ # port_dict = self._create_port_with_qos() # port_dict['qos_policy_id'] = TEST_POLICY_ID2 # self.agent.port_update(None, port=port_dict) # self.wait_until_bandwidth_limit_rule_applied(port_dict, # TEST_BW_LIMIT_RULE_2) # def test_policy_rule_delete(self): # port_dict = self._create_port_with_qos() # policy_copy = copy.deepcopy(self.qos_policies[TEST_POLICY_ID1]) # policy_copy.rules = list() # consumer_reg.push(resources.QOS_POLICY, policy_copy, events.UPDATED) # commit_message:
[WIP] Fix Open vSwitch Firewall antispoofing rules

This patch addresses a number of short comings in the Open vSwitch
firewall implementation.

Validate source MAC and IP on DHCP discovery messages.

Restrict ICMPv6 traffic permitted by fixed rules to just that traffic
required to perform duplicate address detection, rather than
ICMPV6_ALLOWED_TYPES which defines traffic which should be permitted
ingress to an instance. This includes permitting MLD (Multicast Listener
Discovery) report messages for both versions 1 and 2 of the MLD
protocol.

Validate the source MAC address of this ICMPv6 traffic.

Move ICMPV6_ALLOWED_UNSPEC_ADDR_TYPES into agent firewall module with
FirewallDriver base class so it can be used by both the IPtables
firewall and the OVS firewall implementations.

Change-Id: Ia1f9d768004871d743d2c7b979de1439667efe52
Closes-Bug: 1502933
Closes-Bug: 1558658
Closes-Bug: 1575225

commit_message:
tempest: introduce a decorator to tag all test cases in a class

Tagging every single method in a 'negative' class with a 'negative' tag
is error prone and wasteful. Instead, introduce a decorator that would
mark all test cases of a test class with a set of tags.

Change-Id: I6f310313fdf5e2953d073090f7e06b7c0743eedf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/21/307721/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import inspect def global_attr(type): def inner(cls): for name, tcase in inspect.getmembers(cls, inspect.ismethod): if name.startswith('test_'): setattr(cls, name, test.attr(type=type)(tcase)) return cls return inner

commit_message:
Make HA_VRRP_PRIORITY configurable

HA_VRRP_PRIORITY currently is set to 50 as hardcode, and it's not
configurable.

The patch provides a approach to make one special network node
act as master(or slave) by configuring initial priority.

DocImpact: a previously unused configuration value
           ha_vrrp_priority is now used to configure default
           priority of vrrp(managed by keepalived).

Change-Id: I22c14bd2080bf91959b32be253868952cc2a6801
Closes-Bug: #1571448
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/84/306984/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OPTS = [ cfg.IntOpt('ha_default_priority', default=50, help=_('HA default priority for keepalived.')), ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(OPTS) priority=cfg.CONF.ha_default_priority, advert_int=None,

subject: Correctly handle non-SNAT DVR nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-26 21:47:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/37a34039124f0fd86dd6d1d5ef2ad618f113eec1', 'message': 'Catch exception when there is no SNAT namespace on node

The IPSec driver code loops through all routers looking for SNAT
namespaces for DVR routers.  On the network nodes that are not hosting
the SNAT namespace for a particular router, an AttributeException
is generated causing the current driver operation to terminate.

This patch wraps namespace name assignment in a try/except block
and returns None in case of error.

Change-Id: I8ca95526f50d8fbbbce84e4096f73271d0b88397
Closes-Bug: 1481329
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-22 16:49:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/25f20dcc1a41b73b9fbec2e3a377f6424cdbaa7b', 'message': 'Correctly handle non-SNAT DVR nodes

The IPSec driver code loops through all routers looking for SNAT
namespaces for DVR routers.  On the network nodes that are not hosting
the SNAT namespace for a particular router, an AttributeException
is generated causing the current driver operation to terminate.

This patch makes use of the router.get_valid_snat_namespace_name()
call to ensure it is operating on the correct node.

Change-Id: I8ca95526f50d8fbbbce84e4096f73271d0b88397
Depends-On: I09fadb745cb7ca1b073920b82185ab6dc90dccfc
Closes-Bug: 1481329
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly handle non-SNAT DVR nodes

The IPSec driver code loops through all routers looking for SNAT
namespaces for DVR routers.  On the network nodes that are not hosting
the SNAT namespace for a particular router, an AttributeException
is generated causing the current driver operation to terminate.

This patch makes use of the router.get_valid_snat_namespace_name()
call to ensure it is operating on the correct node.

Change-Id: I8ca95526f50d8fbbbce84e4096f73271d0b88397
Depends-On: I09fadb745cb7ca1b073920b82185ab6dc90dccfc
Closes-Bug: 1481329
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/16/310316/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: retname = router.snat_namespace.name except AttributeError: retname = None return retname

subject: Set global_defs in keepalived.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 13:40:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ea2f690fd2f76a793449a37a4f2bf3f68168156b', 'message': 'Add configuration option to change keepalived globals

This patch exposes as configuration options keepalived.conf options:

- notification_email_from as keepalived_email_from
- router_id as keepalived_router_id

By default keepalived uses "admin@$HOSTNAME" and "$HOSTNAME" for
"notification_email_from" and "router_id" respectively, this works for
most of the environments, but when the machine cannot resolve the
hostname via /etc/hosts nor the configured DNS, the master keepalived
process will get blocked until the dns lookup times out and the backup
will promote itself to master, so both processes will have configured
the floating IPs.

To workaround this problem is possible to set notification_email_from to
"admin@localhost" and router_id to "foobar", that will prevent
keepalived from doind dns requests when the configuration is reloaded.

Change-Id: I43d4f5d23c43e0603805899e565fb77745745497
Closes-Bug: #1511722
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-07 14:38:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2606f057354c6f97fe3a44d23b0285b087d39164', 'message': 'Add configuration option to change keepalived globals

To workaround this problem is possible to set notification_email_from to

Closes-Bug: #1511722
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-26 21:22:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4f6af47b5753094cd281dbe5346124813e475260', 'message': 'Set global_defs in keepalived.conf

commit_message:
Set global_defs in keepalived.conf

By default keepalived uses "admin@$HOSTNAME" and "$HOSTNAME" for
"notification_email_from" and "router_id" respectively, this works for
most of the environments, but when the machine cannot resolve the
hostname via /etc/hosts nor the configured DNS, the master keepalived
process will get blocked until the dns lookup times out and the backup
will promote itself to master, so both processes will have configured
the same floating IPs.

To prevent this problem router_id is set to 'neutron and
notification_email_from is set to 'neutron@openstack.dummy', this avoids
extra DNS requests while the configuration is reloaded.

Change-Id: I43d4f5d23c43e0603805899e565fb77745745497
Closes-Bug: #1511722
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/66/302766/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('keepalived_email_from', default=None, help=_('Keepalived email address use in the From header')), cfg.StrOpt('keepalived_router_id', default=None, help=_('Keepalived router id, used to identify the machine')), ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(OPTS) config = ['global_defs {', ] if cfg.CONF.keepalived_email_from: config.append(' notification_email_from %s' % cfg.CONF.keepalived_email_from) if cfg.CONF.keepalived_router_id: config.append(' router_id %s' % cfg.CONF.keepalived_router_id) config.append('}')

commit_message:
Display stdout/stderr for execute when debug=True

There are times when something fails when log_fail_as_error or
check_exit_code is not set, particularly ovs_lib ovs-vsctl calls,
and even when debug=True, you'd only get the exit code in the logs
to try to deduce what happened. We already have the data, so there
is no real reason not to display it when debug=True.

Change-Id: I07a1b97399adfc52b4f19795faf56349ba70bdff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/90/306590/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = _("Exit code: %(returncode)d; " "Stdin: %(stdin)s; " "Stdout: %(stdout)s; " "Stderr: %(stderr)s") % { 'returncode': returncode, 'stdin': process_input or '', 'stdout': _stdout, 'stderr': _stderr} if returncode and returncode not in extra_ok_codes: LOG.debug(msg)
deleted_lines: if returncode and returncode not in extra_ok_codes: msg = _("Exit code: %(returncode)d; " "Stdin: %(stdin)s; " "Stdout: %(stdout)s; " "Stderr: %(stderr)s") % { 'returncode': returncode, 'stdin': process_input or '', 'stdout': _stdout, 'stderr': _stderr} LOG.debug("Exit code: %d", returncode)

subject: Don't create floating IP port in transaction
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 12:40:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3bafcf853e2ff65b58bd7d8cc03b52c398749cab', 'message': "Don't create floating IP port in transaction

Don't call create_port inside of a transaction for the
floating IPs backend port. It's incompatible with ML2's
transaction model and may lead to inconsistencies on failures.
See the partial bug for more details.

This makes an attempt to cleanup the port if there is a failure,
but there is a chance the port will be committed and the server
will die or fail to clean it up on a failure. At this point the
admin will need to manually delete the port.

Change-Id: Id7df049602d9c3de55de5a133fb6cad280a85030
Partial-Bug: #1540844

Partial-Bug: #1540844
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create floating IP port in transaction

Don't call create_port inside of a transaction for the
floating IPs backend port. It's incompatible with ML2's
transaction model and may lead to inconsistencies on failures.
See the partial bug for more details.

This makes an attempt to cleanup the port if there is a failure,
but there is a chance the port will be committed and the server
will die or fail to clean it up on a failure. At this point the
admin will need to manually delete the port.

Change-Id: Id7df049602d9c3de55de5a133fb6cad280a85030
Partial-Bug: #1540844

This commit introduces /v2/collection/health and

commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Introduce <...>/health path into APIv2

This commit introduces /v2/collection/health and
/v2/collection/resource/health paths into APIv2, and for such
collections/resources that have registered health checks it calls health
check plugin.

This implementation is fairly easy and not too much effort has been put
into it yet. It is there to enable easy testing of the health service
plugin. There are definitely better ways to achieve this functionality.
Any insights on what way of implementation would be the best to achieve
this goal would be appreciated.

For this set of related commits, the "ping" check would be available by
invoking the following commands:

 $ openstack token issue
 $ TOKEN=[... ID from the command above ...]
 $ PORT_ID=[... ID of one of the DHCP/router ports ...]
 $ curl -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
        -d '{"ping": {"target": "10.0.0.20"} }' -X POST \
        "http://localhost:9696/v2.0/ports/$PORT_ID/health"

Change-Id: Id94215cb57f2350275603ce5fbd15f9ab3803e6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/63/322163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.plugins.common import constantsHEALTH_SUBROOT = 'health' service_plugins = manager.NeutronManager.get_service_plugins() health_plugin = service_plugins.get(constants.HEALTH) submapper = mapper.collection(collection, resource, **mapper_kwargs) if health_plugin: health_controller = base.create_health_resource( collection, resource, health_plugin, parent=parent) if health_plugin.has_checks_for_collection(collection): submapper.link(HEALTH_SUBROOT, action="execute_operations", conditions={'method': "POST"}, controller=health_controller) if health_plugin.has_checks_for_resource(resource): submapper.member.link(HEALTH_SUBROOT, action="execute_operations", conditions={'method': "POST"}, controller=health_controller) return submapper

commit_message:
devstack: configure service plugins using aliases

Full import paths are implementation details, we should recommend using
aliases:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/stevedore/tutorial/naming.html#names-and-namespaces

Change-Id: I28fe1e736eba397c42624563881f8952a82b43b4

commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Enable L3/DHCP agent health checking

This commit adds health checking capabilities to L3 and DHCP agents. It
does not provide any health check implementation yet, this is left to a
separate commit.

Change-Id: I558dc39c2bdf2913fee13af31ba30298337e65ed

commit_message:
validate_firewall_driver

In setup.cfg, 'noop' could be instead of the long name,
but it only verifies whether firewall_driver is the long name
 in function validate_firewall_driver

Change-Id: If440d702dc00bd37a01ad69277c71f1a378bd2d1

subject: HA: notify l2pop on port status update in slave
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-21 15:15:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/dfc0af3be5f33cbb2944c3720c9a655ddc00cb48', 'message': "notify l2pop on HA agent restart

l2pop is notified about HA router interface ports only when
agent becomes master. But when any agent is restarted or
HA router is added to new agent or removed from any agent,
l2pop is not notified and tunnels can't be created between
this agent and other agents.

This change allows l2pop driver to be notified when any HA agent
plugs/unplugs HA router interface ports. Port's status, and on
which agent the port's status has changed is notified to l2pop driver.

It reverts https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141114/

Change-Id: I7207a9fd1bf7aa4a310035371430e4c8ca5d1706
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-02 15:56:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/77ae6543c41c997846a011a12869bf2d70251298', 'message': "HA: notify l2pop on port status update in slave

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/255237/ sets up flood flows
between slave agents and other agents.

But when l2 agent in slave node is restarted, flood flows in slave
nodes are deleted and not setup again.
When existing HA router is added to new slave agent, the new slave
agent also can't create flood flows to other agents.
When HA router is removed from slave agent, other agents are not
informed about this removal.
Please see [1] and [2] in bug for complete description of the problem.

This change allows plugin to notify l2pop driver when update_device_up
or update_device_down is called by slave node. Then l2pop driver can
inform the slave agent to create flood flows to other agents.

when HA router is removed from agent(if it is last port on that agent)
l2pop informs other agents to delete flood flows to this agent.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/4
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/3

Partial-Bug: #1522980
Change-Id: I7207a9fd1bf7aa4a310035371430e4c8ca5d1706

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-28 08:19:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/24d8f5f205887561373f66112f438c17b4e3c79b', 'message': "HA: notify l2pop on port status update in slave

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/255237/ sets up flood flows
between slave agents and other agents.

L2pop driver is not notified about port status changes in slave agents,
because of this in the following scenarios, flood flows in slave nodes
are not created.
1)When l2 agent in slave node is restarted, existing flood flows in
  slave nodes are deleted and not setup again.
2) When existing HA router is added to new slave agent, the new slave
   agent also can't create flood flows to other agents.
3) When HA router is removed from slave agent, other agents are not
   informed about this removal.
Please see [1] and [2] in bug for complete description of the problem.

This change allows plugin to notify l2pop driver when update_device_up
or update_device_down is called by any HA node.
For update_device_up, l2pop driver informs all HA agents(including the new HA agent) to
create flood flows to other agents.
For update_device_down, l2pop checks if HA router is removed from agent,
if that is true and if it is last port on that agent, it informs other
agents to delete flood flows to this HA agent.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/4
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/3

Closes-bug: #1522980
Change-Id: I7207a9fd1bf7aa4a310035371430e4c8ca5d1706

because of this in the following scenarios, flood flows in slave nodes
are not created.
1)When l2 agent in slave node is restarted, existing flood flows in
  slave nodes are deleted and not setup again.
2) When existing HA router is added to new slave agent, the new slave
   agent also can't create flood flows to other agents.
3) When HA router is removed from slave agent, other agents are not
   informed about this removal.
Please see [1] and [2] in bug for complete description of the problem.

This change allows plugin to notify l2pop driver when update_device_up
or update_device_down is called by any HA node.
For update_device_up, l2pop driver informs all HA agents(including the new HA agent) to
create flood flows to other agents.
For update_device_down, l2pop checks if HA router is removed from agent,
if that is true and if it is last port on that agent, it informs other
agents to delete flood flows to this HA agent.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/4
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/3

Closes-bug: #1522980
Change-Id: I7207a9fd1bf7aa4a310035371430e4c8ca5d1706

commit_message:
HA: notify l2pop on port status update in slave

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/255237/ sets up flood flows
between slave agents and other agents.

L2pop driver is not notified about port status changes in slave agents,
because of this in the following scenarios, flood flows in slave nodes
are not created.
1)When l2 agent in slave node is restarted, existing flood flows in
  slave nodes are deleted and not setup again.
2) When existing HA router is added to new slave agent, the new slave
   agent also can't create flood flows to other agents.
3) When HA router is removed from slave agent, other agents are not
   informed about this removal.
Please see [1] and [2] in bug for complete description of the problem.

This change allows plugin to notify l2pop driver when update_device_up
or update_device_down is called by any HA node.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/4
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/3

Closes-bug: #1522980
Change-Id: I7207a9fd1bf7aa4a310035371430e4c8ca5d1706
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/74/282874/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 13:01:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/13a9c29b4ae9954c01b36e9c2f6fe6e184c3a314', 'message': 'ml2: ovs: apply ACCEPT rules to unfiltered ports

commit_message:
ml2: ovs: apply ACCEPT rules to unfiltered ports

Unfiltered ports (i.e. port_security_enabled set to False) were excluded
from the list of added ports, which meant the security group logic was
never called on them, so no firewall rules were added for those ports.

That's a problem if the default policy for the FORWARD or INPUT chains
on the compute node is to drop packets, because those ports will end up
having all of their traffic dropped in that case.

This commit ensures that the security group logic is applied to
unfiltered ports, which already includes code that adds the relevant
accept rules:

  -A neutron-openvswi-FORWARD -m physdev --physdev-out tapc51048bd-9f
    --physdev-is-bridged -m comment --comment "Accept all packets when
    port security is disabled." -j ACCEPT
  -A neutron-openvswi-FORWARD -m physdev --physdev-in tapc51048bd-9f
    --physdev-is-bridged -m comment --comment "Accept all packets when
    port security is disabled." -j ACCEPT
  -A neutron-openvswi-INPUT -m physdev --physdev-in tapc51048bd-9f
    --physdev-is-bridged -m comment --comment "Accept all packets when
    port security is disabled." -j ACCEPT

Change-Id: I9e4fa6818e4f296bee9da556e011cd70a689141a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/15/289315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Make API errors conform to API-WG schema
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 12:31:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs/commit/3077b5fd34fa9ff979c358ede2f9d299ba5b9fe3', 'message': 'Make API errors conform to API-WG schema

A common API error format [1] has been recommended by API-WG,
which will bring more detailed information about the errors
to help developers and users to find the root reasons easily.

This spec tries to make the neutron API conform to the common
error format.

DocImpact
APIImpact

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html

commit_message:
Make API errors conform to API-WG schema

A common API error format [1] has been recommended by API-WG,
which will bring more detailed information about the errors
to help developers and users to find the root reasons easily.

This spec tries to make the neutron API conform to the common
error format.

DocImpact
APIImpact

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html

Change-Id: I996ea1bf1f95548f5fbd7bba19e42e620efd9f67
Co-Authored-By: caosf <caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com>
Partial-Bug: #1554869
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/04/298704/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Enhance error messages for API users ==================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1554869 This spec is intended to enhance error messages according to the guideline [1]. Formatted messages with better quality will help users and developer learn the API quickly. Consistent error messages across services will make it possible that one service can transport error messages from dependent services to users. Problem Description =================== Currently only limited information, such as 'type' and 'message', in the response message [2] has been exposed to the users, while an error occurred. And it only brings a few hints about the error to users so that it is not quite useful for users, if they want to figure out the root reason for that error. Furthermore, as the lack of unified format for the error message, it is hard to share the error message across multiple projects while they are calling each other. Thus it is hard to support the cross-project tracking for the error. Proposed Change =============== 1. Introduce a new class BaseExceptionMeta. A new class BaseExceptionMeta is introduced into neutron to collect information about problems encountered. According to the guideline [1], BaseExceptionMeta class should contain the following attributes: * request_id: A unique identifier for the request. * code: A service-specific error code. * status: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem. * title: A short, human-readable summary of the problem. * detail: A human-readable explanation of the problem. * links: A set of links for more reference about this problem. For each error code we implement a subclass of BaseExceptionMeta. A ExceptionMeta should be identified by its error code, which is necessary for services like nova to distinguish "What really happened?". Note that there should be a number of error codes as which will be derived not only from the types of exception but also from the actual places where they raised. And this spec only aims to the neutron error codes. For the other projects we will create other specs. 2. Add a wrapper Add a wrapper class around the neutron API interfaces to add a list of BaseExceptionMeta according to various real exceptions, and then re-raise the customised exception again in the wrapper. For more detailed information about the error and distinguish them from each other, hopefully, every error raised in the API interface should associate with a unique error code. By default, a common type of error code associated with the API will be raised while there is no specific error code specified in the API interface. For example: .. code-block:: python @exception_metas.common_err_msg('neutron.api.show.not-found') def show(self): try: ...code stuff... except oslo_policy.PolicyNotAuthorized: msg = _('The resource could not be found.') raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(msg) formatted_exc = exception_metas.raise_formatted_exception( webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(msg), code='neutron.api.show.not-found', request_id=request.context.request_id) raise formatted_exc Note that if the exception contains a list of BaseExceptionMeta, all of them should be included into the formatted message to re-raise together. 3. Enhance the wsgi interface The wsgi interface should be enhanced to support the output for the formatted error message. Note that as the microversion feature hasn't been support yet [3] by neutron, for backward compatibility we have to keep the original error message [2] as a part of the error message, which means the formatted message introduced by this spec will be output together with the old one. For instance: .. code:: { "NeutronError": { <== The original error message under the 'NeutronError' key "detail": "", "message": "The resource could not be found.", "type": "HTTPNotFound" }, "errors": [ <== A list of new error message under the 'errors' key { "code": "neutron.api.show.not-found", "detail": "Can't show the resource as it can't be found for some reasons", "links": [ { "href": "http://docs.openstack.org/", "rel": "help" } ], "request_id": "req-da1cc65b-9a13-491b-a9a8-3de80140a27d", "status": 404, "title": "The resource could not be found" } ] } So there should be a TODO: we will completely clean the original error message from the error message with a new microversion if the microversion feature has been landed into neutron. REST API impact --------------- * When error happens, a changed error message listed by the example above would be output. Other end user impact --------------------- * End user should realize the new error message format brought by this, and then be better to utilize them appropriately. Developer impact ---------------- * Developer should follow this error-code format when new API is introduced. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: * (xiexs, xiexs@cn.fujitsu.com) * (Cao ShuFeng, caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com) Other contributors: * Anyone who wants to design the error-code and provide a help href link is welcome. Work Items ---------- * Introduce BaseExceptionMeta into neutron * Introduce a wrapper into neutron * Introduce a jsonschema validator to check the error message * Add wrapper for all APIs * Add unittests and functional tests * Enhance corresponding API doc Testing ======= * Unit-tests should be implemented * Functional tests on python-neutronclient gates will be implemented Documentation Impact ==================== * The API doc needs to be updated. References ========== * [1]: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html * [2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/113570/ * [3]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/136760/

Remove the dependency between arp_responder and l2_pop.
In this change, existing arp_responder uses port_update and
port_delete notifications to update arp entries for ports,
instead of l2_pop.

arp_responder functionality remains same i.e

1) when a new port is added on a agent, all other agents will add arp

2) when a new port is the first port in a network on the scheduled agent,
then arp entries for all ports(on the same network but on other agents)

Similarly if last port is deleted on the network on the agent, arp entries
for other ports on the network on that agent will be removed.

This change implements arp_responder on integration bridge rather than
on tunneling bridge. It uses port_update and port_delete notifications
to update arp entries for ports, instead of l2_pop.
The advantages of this approach are -
1) arp_responder can be enabled without l2pop driver
2) support arp_responder for all network types(vlans, vxlan, etc)
   arp_responder based on l2pop is supported for only overlay networks.
3) arp for distributed ports(DVR and HA). This is not supported in
   l2pop based arp_responder.
4) arp packets for local ports(ports connected to same br-int)resolved
   in br-int without broadcasting to actual ports connected to br-int.

This change will be only enabled with a new config
'arp_responder_on_integration_bridge'. It doesn't use 'arp_responder'
 config. There is no dependency between these two approaches.
Users can still use l2pop based arp_responder on tunnel bridge with
'arp_responder' config(And users can enable both, but then arp_responder
will be present on both on br-int and br-tun).

Like l2pop, arp entries for network ports will be added only if the
network is added to host. When a port is added to a host on a network,
and if that is first port on the host on that network, with a new RPC
"get_ports_by_network", host gets all ports belonging to that network
and add arp entries for them.

When ARP spoofing is enabled, ARP will be resolved after spoofing i.e
after ARP spoofing is success, then packet is resubmitted to
ARP_RESPONDER table. When ARP spoofing is disbaled, ARP packets will be
resubmitted from table 0 to ARP_RESPONDER table. When no ARP entry
matches in ARP_RESPONDER table, packet will be flooded through NORMAL
action in integration bridge.

ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int).

commit_message:
setup arp_responder on integration bridge

This change implements arp_responder on integration bridge rather than
on tunneling bridge. It uses port_update and port_delete notifications
to update arp entries for ports, instead of l2_pop.
The advantages of this approach are -
1) arp_responder can be enabled without l2pop driver
2) support arp_responder for all network types(vlans, vxlan, etc)
   arp_responder based on l2pop is supported for only overlay networks.
3) arp for distributed ports(DVR and HA). This is not supported in
   l2pop based arp_responder.
4) arp packets for local ports(ports connected to same br-int)resolved
   in br-int without broadcasting to actual ports connected to br-int.

This change will be only enabled with a new config
'arp_responder_on_integration_bridge'. It doesn't use 'arp_responder'
 config. There is no dependency between these two approaches.
Users can still use l2pop based arp_responder on tunnel bridge with
'arp_responder' config(And users can enable both, but then arp_responder
will be present on both on br-int and br-tun).

Like l2pop, arp entries for network ports will be added only if the
network is added to host. When a port is added to a host on a network,
and if that is first port on the host on that network, with a new RPC
"get_ports_by_network", host gets all ports belonging to that network
and add arp entries for them.

When ARP spoofing is enabled, ARP will be resolved after spoofing i.e
after ARP spoofing is success, then packet is resubmitted to
ARP_RESPONDER table. When ARP spoofing is disbaled, ARP packets will be
resubmitted from table 0 to ARP_RESPONDER table. When no ARP entry
matches in ARP_RESPONDER table, packet will be flooded through NORMAL
action in integration bridge.

flows with arp responder and arp spoofing on br-int(i.e
ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int).
(note: some unnecessary fields removed for readability)
table=0, priority=10,icmp6,in_port=2,icmp_type=136 actions=resubmit(,24)
table=0, priority=10,arp,in_port=2 actions=resubmit(,24)

table=21, priority=1,arp,dl_vlan=1,arp_tpa=30.0.0.3 actions=move:NXM_OF_ETH_SRC[]->NXM_OF_ETH_DST[],mod_dl_src:fa:16:3e:8e:c0:1e,load:0x2->NXM_OF_ARP_OP[],move:NXM_NX_ARP_SHA[]->NXM_NX_ARP_THA[],move:NXM_OF_ARP_SPA[]->NXM_OF_ARP_TPA[],load:0xfa163e8ec01e->NXM_NX_ARP_SHA[],load:0x1e000003->NXM_OF_ARP_SPA[],IN_PORT

commit_message:
Restrict using provider subnet as router interface

When a subnet which belong to a provider network is
added as router interface, it interfers with the actual physical
network gateway of the provider.

With this patch, we add a validation to ensure that if the network
has its physical_network attribute set then we dont allow it to be
added as a router interface.

Change-Id: I74cff1056d02496ea65b3fc5f5f9044c74cb6eb9
Closes-bug: #1556074

subject: Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 15:13:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3a6d0a7e69a4e9f9e83c8f23f007f3c4cebaef8d', 'message': "Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist

Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist

Linux bridge is not handling RuntimeError exception when it is trying
to delete network's bridge, which is deleted in parallel by nova.
Fullstack test has similar scenario, it creates network's bridge for
agent and deletes the bridge after the test, like nova.

Linux bridge agent has to ignore RuntimeError exception if the bridge
doesn't exist.

Closes-bug: #1561040
(cherry picked from commit 16b2ffdfd85eece8fb57a98d10bf35ad617d235a)

Change-Id: I8451a1dbe25dcda5e9072b60e4329da5fd319433

commit_message:
Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist

Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist

Linux bridge is not handling RuntimeError exception when it is trying
to delete network's bridge, which is deleted in parallel by nova.
Fullstack test has similar scenario, it creates network's bridge for
agent and deletes the bridge after the test, like nova.

Linux bridge agent has to ignore RuntimeError exception if the bridge
doesn't exist.

Closes-bug: #1561040
(cherry picked from commit 16b2ffdfd85eece8fb57a98d10bf35ad617d235a)

Change-Id: I8451a1dbe25dcda5e9072b60e4329da5fd319433
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/49/300549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: bridge_device = bridge_lib.BridgeDevice(bridge_name) LOG.debug("Deleting bridge %s", bridge_name) if bridge_device.link.set_down(): return if bridge_device.delbr(): return LOG.debug("Done deleting bridge %s", bridge_name) except RuntimeError: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() as ctxt: if not bridge_device.exists(): # the exception was likely a side effect of the bridge # being removed by nova during handling, # so we just return ctxt.reraise = False LOG.debug("Cannot delete bridge %s; it does not exist", bridge_name) return
deleted_lines: LOG.debug("Deleting bridge %s", bridge_name) bridge_device = bridge_lib.BridgeDevice(bridge_name) if bridge_device.link.set_down(): return if bridge_device.delbr(): return LOG.debug("Done deleting bridge %s", bridge_name)

subject: Do not delete dhcp port when purge tenant's resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-06 06:28:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/36403556b4b023317d190e43cca21d49a4f2e93d', 'message': "Do not delete dhcp port when purge tenant's resource

The original purge logic will delete all ports which are owned by
specified tenant. So it will delete the dhcp port, it will cause new port
can not get ip addr during rebuilding dhcp port, and the new dhcp port's
tenant is still the same as network's tenant. dhcp port will be deleted
through net-delete or subnet-delete. So we should ignore this unnecessary
and risky operation when purge.

This patch ignore the device_owner is 'network:dhcp'. Purge operation
won't delete dhcp port.

Closes-Bug: #1566656
Change-Id: I6b0b9ef869033ae77c81052d74affa97c267813d

commit_message:
Do not delete dhcp port when purge tenant's resource

The original purge logic will delete all ports which are owned by
specified tenant. So it will delete the dhcp port, it will cause new port
can not get ip addr during rebuilding dhcp port, and the new dhcp port's
tenant is still the same as network's tenant. dhcp port will be deleted
through net-delete or subnet-delete. So we should ignore this unnecessary
and risky operation when purge.

This patch ignore the device_owner is 'network:dhcp'. Purge operation
won't delete dhcp port.

Closes-Bug: #1566656
Change-Id: I6b0b9ef869033ae77c81052d74affa97c267813d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/46/302046/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_purge_dhcp_port(self): tenant_purge = 'tenant-purge' tenant_other = 'tenant-other' name = 'not-purge' self.neutron('net-create', params=('%(name)s --tenant-id %(tenant)s' % {'name': name, 'tenant': tenant_purge})) self.addCleanup(self._safe_cleanup, 'net-delete %s' % name) self._create_subnet(name, tenant_other, '1.1.1.0/24') self.addCleanup(self._safe_cleanup, 'subnet-delete %s' % name) purge_output = self.neutron('purge', params=tenant_purge).strip() if not purge_output: self.fail('Purge command did not return feedback') # The original logic will return 1 port deleted, the port is for dhcp. # Now the returned message is like below. self.assertEqual(purge_output, 'The following resources could not be deleted:' '1 network.')

commit_message:
Fix swift ring distribute

The swift ring distribute task was using the Synchronize module
which is broken in ansible 2.1 when using become and delegate_to.
The become and delegate_to methods are required to make the module
pull from a remote source to another remote source using a specific
user. To resolve the issue these tasks have been changed to use the
command module.

Related-Issue: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/15405

Change-Id: I1f0a14759408e3efd066a8adf4510db688d01437
Closes-bug: #1597475
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/24/336624/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(cloudnull): These methods have been changed to use the rsync command # instead of the Synchronize module. The change was required due to an upstream # issue with the module when running with delegate_to and become. Sadly the fix # does not seem to be trivial. "https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/15405" command: | rsync -e 'ssh -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no' \ -avz {{ swift_system_user_name }}@{{ hostvars[groups['swift_hosts'][0]]['ansible_ssh_host'] }}:/etc/swift/ring_build_files/ \ /etc/swift/ - skip_ansible_lint command: | rsync -e 'ssh -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no' \ -avz {{ swift_system_user_name }}@{{ hostvars[groups['swift_hosts'][0]]['ansible_ssh_host'] }}:/etc/swift/ring_build_files/ \ /etc/swift/ring_build_files/ - skip_ansible_lint
deleted_lines: synchronize: src: "/etc/swift/ring_build_files/" mode: push dest: "/etc/swift/" set_remote_user: False delegate_to: "{{ groups['swift_hosts'][0] }}" synchronize: src: "/etc/swift/ring_build_files/" mode: push dest: "/etc/swift/ring_build_files/" set_remote_user: False delegate_to: "{{ groups['swift_hosts'][0] }}"
