It's related to # https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/mistral-custom-actions-api if a_m.has_action_context( self.action_def.action_class, self.action_def.attributes or {}) and self.task_ex: input_dict.update( a_m.get_action_context(self.task_ex, action_ex_id) ) desc=desc if save: self._create_action_execution(input_dict, runtime_ctx, desc=desc)

commit_message:
Proper ordering for objects loaded from templates

- Use OrderedDict for loading objects from yaml template.
- Load objects from db with the order they were saved.
  It guarantees that objects will be defined in the same order
  that they appear in template file.
- added id field to Group
- added unit tests for yaml_template_load

Related-Bug: #1591750
Change-Id: I2cafa1fbe156b1ddbd5546d06938e65c9b6bf4bf

commit_message:
libvirt: fix reporting if libguestfs can't read host kernel

Current log has a mistake with judgement of getting read permission
to the host kernel. when it doesn't have reading permission,it will
not report "exception.LibguestfsCannotReadKernel"

Related-Bug: #1413142

Change-Id: Ic6802650cb8f93e0d02c51e9014eb85a7e71f6fe
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/337091/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not os.access("/boot/vmlinuz-%s" % os.uname()[2], os.R_OK):

class Resource(object):
    def __init__(self, person):
        self.person = person

    def __eq__(self, other):
        return self.person == other.person

class MyTestCase(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_eq(self):
        r1 = Resource("test")
        r2 = Resource("test")
        self.assertEqual(r1, r2)
        self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2)

commit_message:
base.Resource not define __ne__() built-in function

Class base.Resource defines __eq__() built-in function, but does
not define __ne__() built-in function, so self.assertEqual works
but self.assertNotEqual does not work at all in this test case in
python2. This patch fixes it by defining __ne__() built-in function
of class base.Resource. Also fixes spelling errors:resoruces.

Change-Id: I845d531880ad74d928a3e15335ed10e71590826e
Closes-Bug: #1586268
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/08/322408/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def test_eq(self): # Two resources with same ID: never equal if their info is not equal r1 = base.Resource(None, {'id': 1, 'name': 'hi'}) r2 = base.Resource(None, {'id': 1, 'name': 'hello'}) self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2) # Two resources with same ID: equal if their info is equal r1 = base.Resource(None, {'id': 1, 'name': 'hello'}) r2 = base.Resource(None, {'id': 1, 'name': 'hello'}) self.assertEqual(r1, r2) # Two resoruces of different types: never equal r1 = base.Resource(None, {'id': 1}) r2 = volumes.Volume(None, {'id': 1}) self.assertNotEqual(r1, r2) # Two resources with no ID: equal if their info is equal r1 = base.Resource(None, {'name': 'joe', 'age': 12}) r2 = base.Resource(None, {'name': 'joe', 'age': 12}) self.assertEqual(r1, r2)

commit_message:
Restriction on sequence of allowed address pairs

Since the order in which we receive the allowed address pair doesn't
matter, we should remove the order/sequence dependency in
_update_port_with_address method. The proposed solution is to assert
on the items in the allowed address pairs.

Closes-Bug: 1594633
Change-Id: Ibada9d24c0d018163cad575067def1c2ed20333f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/22/331822/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add client-publish-job group
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-02 11:57:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/bb3c210e2fc007382e0927e93b47ebdb44ecb848', 'message': 'Add client-publish-job group

We defined with the openstack-publish-jobs group both doc and
doc-tags-only jobs, but each repos uses either of these, never both of
them.

Create a new openstack-client-publish-jobs group and use that as
appropriate. Remove the docs-tags-only job from
openstack-publish-jobs.

This removes 387 unused jobs.

commit_message:
Add client-publish-job group

We defined with the openstack-publish-jobs group both doc and
doc-tags-only jobs, but each repos uses either of these, never both of
them.

Create a new openstack-client-publish-jobs group and use that as
appropriate. Remove the docs-tags-only job from
openstack-publish-jobs.

This removes 387 unused jobs.

Change-Id: I441c75debe9e9f744790a60cc51d93eef6460a9c

commit_message:
Define coverage jobs when needed

Split up coverage jobs definition from python-jobs, introduce new job
groups coverage-jobs and coverage-jobs-db. Use these new groups for
those repos that run coverage jobs.

This should remove 376 jobs from JJB.

Change-Id: I742d64f28e7c410e1a0ff86c892277e729fe2f28

commit_message:
Remove depends_on: Networks from ControllerServiceChain

I think this depends_on is bogus - the Controller ResourceGroup does
depend on Networks, but not the ControllerServiceChain - this needs to
be consistent with the other ServiceChain definitions for the
custom-roles work.

Change-Id: I0159968719f5d21c8f216ad69af047fa141d54e9

subject: Update Gemfile to work in gate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 15:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['Gemfile'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/ace0f6784f87a6e1761f9fc6bec829a6d4be6652', 'message': "Update Gemfile to work in gate

Puppet-lint v1.1.0 (the most recent release in the 1.x series) has a
crashing bug, so we were depending on puppet-lint HEAD. On 2016-06-22,
puppet-lint v2.0.0 was released, so puppet-lint HEAD is now in the v2
series. But puppet-lint_variable_contains_upcase depends on puppet-lint
v1, so puppet-lint HEAD no longer satisfies our dependencies.

This patch pins the version of puppet-lint to the commit immediately
before the v2.0.0 release, so we get the bug fix and satisfy
puppet-lint_variable_contains_upcase's dependencies.

Change-Id: I3eab1b883a3dc5ca5d02d4c71b97507d36d7f349
Closes-bug: #1597849
"}]
commit_message:
Update Gemfile to work in gate

Puppet-lint v1.1.0 (the most recent release in the 1.x series) has a
crashing bug, so we were depending on puppet-lint HEAD. On 2016-06-22,
puppet-lint v2.0.0 was released, so puppet-lint HEAD is now in the v2
series. But puppet-lint_variable_contains_upcase depends on puppet-lint
v1, so puppet-lint HEAD no longer satisfies our dependencies.

This patch pins the version of puppet-lint to the commit immediately
before the v2.0.0 release, so we get the bug fix and satisfy
puppet-lint_variable_contains_upcase's dependencies.

Change-Id: I3eab1b883a3dc5ca5d02d4c71b97507d36d7f349
Closes-bug: #1597849
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/69/337269/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add python35 jobs

Add python35 unittest jobs across the board where there were preexisting
python34 jobs. These jobs are all non voting to start. Projects can
switch to voting when they are happy with the results.

Note this doesn't add python35 jobs for the one off special python34
jobs that some projects have.

Change-Id: Ic2a0699e1810953b4f54e72017dfbc55725dd80e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 09:02:53.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/59b6b5d5ebfabee6d7d367f21e7dbc99531e5e38', 'message': 'Cleanup IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER_ISCSI_WITH_IPA variable

Reference:
[0] https://review.openstack.org/327083/

Change-Id: I47801ba2281b881dfbc1d05a5e7c7031a48b2126

commit_message:
Cleanup IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER_ISCSI_WITH_IPA variable

Support of old ramdisk has been deprecated at [0].
This patch removes setting IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER_ISCSI_WITH_IPA
from jobs.

Reference:
[0] https://review.openstack.org/327083/

Change-Id: I47801ba2281b881dfbc1d05a5e7c7031a48b2126

commit_message:
Adding OsloRPC server and client

 * Using new RPC interface OsloRPCServer and
   OsloRPCClient are created.

TODO (next commits):
 - integrate new RPC interface in Mistral
 - make RPC implementation configurable
 - unit tests

Partially implements blueprint mistral-alternative-rpc

Co-Authored-By: Dawid Deja <dawid.deja@intel.com>
Change-Id: I6c9770a5b84509529abc14dff2b4a9f6e3411951

deleted_lines: from mistral.engine.rpc_direct import base as rpc_base

commit_message:
Add tests for bonding mode

Verify bonding non-admin interface in LACP, active-backup
Verify bonding of admin interface in active-backup, balance-rr

Change-Id: I2fc1f74aa650d47e2318e2752a79d5b53e4eb897
Closes-Bug: #1598736
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/69/337069/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: }; selectBondType(bondName, bondMode) { return this.remote .findByCssSelector('.' + bondName + ' .ifc-header') .then((ifcsHeader) => { if (!ifcsHeader) throw new Error('Unable to select Bonding Mode ' + bondName + ' for Bond ' + bondName); return ifcsHeader .findByCssSelector('.form-group select option[value="' + bondMode + '"]') .then((selectOption) => selectOption.click()) }) };

subject: Add support for metrics
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-05 09:12:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-lib/commit/d6c7dc2d82d709585c9499386c29e309f3135339', 'message': 'Add support for metrics

This patch adds metrics to ironic-lib, so that it can be used by both
Ironic and IPA. It implements a generic MetricLogger including timers,
counters, and gauges with their respective decorators and context
managers. Two default MetricLogger are included: NoopMetricLogger and
StatsdMetricLogger.

Change-Id: I8a62414e6c03acb6f3457f1b8f81c03a9d3a8576
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@pcsforeducation.com>

commit_message:
Add support for metrics

This patch adds metrics to ironic-lib, so that it can be used by both
Ironic and IPA. It implements a generic MetricLogger including timers,
counters, and gauges with their respective decorators and context
managers. Two default MetricLogger are included: NoopMetricLogger and
StatsdMetricLogger.

Change-Id: I8a62414e6c03acb6f3457f1b8f81c03a9d3a8576
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@pcsforeducation.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Weeks <alex.weeks@gmail.com>
Partial-Bug: #1526219

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Rackspace Hosting # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc import contextlib import functools import random import socket import time from contextlib import contextmanager from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log import six metrics_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('backend', default='noop', help='Backend to use for the metrics system. Default possible ' 'backends are "noop" and "statsd".'), cfg.BoolOpt('prepend_host', default=False, help='Prepend the value of CONF.host to all metric names. ' 'The format of metric names is ' '[global_prefix.][host_name.]prefix.metric_name.'), cfg.BoolOpt('prepend_host_reverse', default=True, help='Split the prepended host value by "." and reverse it ' '(to better match the reverse hierarchical form of domain ' 'names).'), cfg.StrOpt('global_prefix', default='', help='Prefix all metric names with this value ' 'The format of metric names is ' '[global_prefix.][host_name.]prefix.metric_name.'), cfg.StrOpt('statsd_host', default='localhost', help='Host for use with the statsd backend.'), cfg.IntOpt('statsd_port', default=8125, help='Port to use with the statsd backend.') ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(metrics_opts, group='metrics') LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) def _time(): return time.time() @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class MetricLogger(object): """Abstract class representing a metrics logger.""" def __init__(self, prefix_parts, delimiter): if isinstance(prefix_parts, six.string_types): self._prefix_parts = [prefix_parts] else: self._prefix_parts = list(prefix_parts) self._delimiter = delimiter def _getMetricName(self, m_parts): if isinstance(m_parts, six.string_types): m_parts = [m_parts] return self._delimiter.join(self._prefix_parts + list(m_parts)) def gauge(self, m_parts, m_value): """Send gauge metric data.""" self._gauge(self._getMetricName(m_parts), m_value) def counter(self, m_parts, m_value, sample_rate=None): """Send counter metric data. Optionally, specify sample_rate in the interval [0.0, 1.0] to sample data probabilistically where: P(send metric data) = sample_rate If sample_rate is None, then always send metric data, but do not have the backend send sample rate information (if supported). """ if (sample_rate is not None and (sample_rate < 0.0 or sample_rate > 1.0)): raise ValueError("sample_rate must be None, or in the interval " "[0.0, 1.0]") if sample_rate is None or random.random() < sample_rate: return self._counter(self._getMetricName(m_parts), m_value, sample_rate=sample_rate) def timer(self, m_parts, m_value): """Send timer data.""" self._timer(self._getMetricName(m_parts), m_value) @abc.abstractmethod def _gauge(self, m_parts, m_value): """Abstract method for backends to implement gauge behavior.""" @abc.abstractmethod def _counter(self, m_parts, m_value, sample_rate=None): """Abstract method for backends to implement counter behavior.""" @abc.abstractmethod def _timer(self, m_parts, m_value): """Abstract method for backends to implement timer behavior.""" def timer_d(self, parts): """Returns a timer decorator that instruments a function. It is bound to this MetricLogger. For example: from ironic_lib import metrics METRICS = metrics.getLogger() @METRICS.timer_d('foo') def foo(bar, baz): print bar, baz """ def decorator(f): @functools.wraps(f) def wrapped(*args, **kwargs): start = _time() result = f(*args, **kwargs) duration = _time() - start # Log the timing data (in ms) self.timer(parts, duration * 1000) return result return wrapped return decorator def counter_d(self, parts, sample_rate=None): """Returns a counter decorator that instruments a function. It is bound to this MetricLogger. For example: from ironic_lib import metrics METRICS = metrics.getLogger() @METRICS.counter_d('foo') def foo(bar, baz): print bar, baz """ def decorator(f): @functools.wraps(f) def wrapped(*args, **kwargs): self.counter(parts, 1, sample_rate=sample_rate) result = f(*args, **kwargs) return result return wrapped return decorator def gauge_d(self, parts): """Returns a gauge decorator that instruments a function. It is bound to this MetricLogger. For example: from ironic_lib import metrics METRICS = metrics.getLogger() @METRICS.gauge_d('foo') def foo(bar, baz): print bar, baz """ def decorator(f): @functools.wraps(f) def wrapped(*args, **kwargs): result = f(*args, **kwargs) self.gauge(parts, result) return result return wrapped return decorator @contextmanager def timer_c(self, parts): """A context manager to instrument a function with a timer It is bound to this MetricLogger. For example: from ironic_lib import metrics METRICS = metrics.getLogger() with METRICS.timer_c('foo'): do_something() """ start = _time() yield duration = _time() - start # Log the timing data (in ms) self.timer(parts, duration * 1000) @contextmanager def counter_c(self, parts, sample_rate=None): """A context manager to instrument a function with a counter It is bound to this MetricLogger. For example: from ironic_lib import metrics METRICS = metrics.getLogger() with METRICS.counter_c('foo'): do_something() """ self.counter(parts, 1, sample_rate=sample_rate) yield class NoopMetricLogger(MetricLogger): """Noop metric logger that throws away all metric data.""" def __init__(self, prefix, delimiter): super(NoopMetricLogger, self).__init__(prefix, delimiter) def _gauge(self, m_name, m_value): pass def _counter(self, m_name, m_value, sample_rate=None): pass def _timer(self, m_name, m_value): pass class StatsdMetricLogger(MetricLogger): """Metric logger that reports data via the statsd protocol.""" GAUGE_TYPE = 'g' COUNTER_TYPE = 'c' TIMER_TYPE = 'ms' def __init__(self, prefix_parts, delimiter, host=None, port=None): """Initialize a StatsdMetricLogger The logger uses the given prefix list, delimiter, host, and port. """ super(StatsdMetricLogger, self).__init__(prefix_parts, delimiter) self._host = host or CONF.metrics.statsd_host self._port = port or CONF.metrics.statsd_port self._target = (self._host, self._port) def _send(self, m_name, m_value, m_type, sample_rate=None): if sample_rate is None: metric = '%s:%s|%s' % (m_name, m_value, m_type) else: metric = '%s:%s|%s@%s' % (m_name, m_value, m_type, sample_rate) # Ideally, we'd cache a sending socket in self, but that # results in a socket getting shared by multiple green threads. with contextlib.closing(self._open_socket()) as sock: return sock.sendto(metric, self._target) def _open_socket(self): return socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_DGRAM) def _gauge(self, m_name, m_value): return self._send(m_name, m_value, self.GAUGE_TYPE) def _counter(self, m_name, m_value, sample_rate=None): return self._send(m_name, m_value, self.COUNTER_TYPE, sample_rate=sample_rate) def _timer(self, m_name, m_value): return self._send(m_name, m_value, self.TIMER_TYPE) def getLogger(prefix): """Return a metric logger with the specified prefix. The format of the prefix is [global_prefix.][host_name.]prefix. """ if isinstance(prefix, six.string_types): prefix = [prefix] if CONF.metrics.prepend_host: host = CONF.host if CONF.metrics.prepend_host_reverse: host = '.'.join(reversed(host.split('.'))) prefix = [host] + prefix if CONF.metrics.global_prefix: prefix = [CONF.metrics.global_prefix] + prefix if CONF.metrics.backend == 'statsd': return StatsdMetricLogger(prefix, '.') elif CONF.metrics.backend == 'noop': return NoopMetricLogger(prefix, '.') else: raise ValueError("Backend %s is not supported. Value should be " "'noop' or 'statsd'." % CONF.metrics.backend)

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Change-Id: I57d7c242b2f2b63d71f7830fe355dbf857ffad58

commit_message:
Replace NodeConfigIdentifiers with DeployIdentifier

We added NodeConfigIdentifiers to trigger config to be re-applied on
update, but then later added DeployIdentifier which forces config to
*always* be applied on update, so we can simplify things by just
referencing the DeployIdentifier directly.

Change-Id: I79212def1936740825b714419dcb4952bc586a39

commit_message:
Reset rabbitmq default for net_ticktime to 60 sec

This parameter should be increased to eliminate the triggering
partition handling logic on spurious network partitions/outages.

Change-Id: Iaadf50bb499d27a5859a4335764a4d7ae49d4a5e
Closes-Bug: #1598154
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

subject: Allow 'openstack baremetal configure boot' to guess the root device
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-19 12:58:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/9be571e4eedf001c8d67544c38f05f9c3e3ce7f5', 'message': "Allow 'openstack baremetal configure boot' to guess the root device

This change simplifies using Ironic root device hints for people who only need
to change the default strategy of selecting the default device.
E.g. we have a use case for selecting the first device instead of the smallest,
so that the root device does not change after upgrade Kilo -> Liberty.

Note that this feature does not replace per-node device hints, rather
complement them with a more global and easy to use setting.

This change introduces 3 new arguments to the command:
--root-device states how to find a root devices for a node.
  If this argument is provided, the client will try to detect the root device
  based on the stored introspection data. Possible values:
  * smallest (the same thing as IPA does by default - the smallest device)
  * largest (the opposite thing - pick the largest device)
  * otherwise it's treated as a comma-separated list of possible device names,
    e.g. sda,vda,hda rouchly matches the logic the Kilo ramdisk used.
  The resulting device WWN or serial (whatever is available) is then recorded
  in the root device hints (/properties/root_device) for a node.
--root-device-minimum-size minimum size of the considered devices
  The default value of 4 GiB matches what IPA does.
--overwrite-root-device-hints allows overwriting root device hints set
  previously. It's disabled by default to allow more precise control over the
  root device for some subset of nodes.

Note that for these arguments to work, this command should be run after
introspection. A separate documentation change will be posted for that.

Change-Id: I9f19554c5e7f34c8f63c1603c32b4d470fb12592

commit_message:
Allow 'openstack baremetal configure boot' to guess the root device

This change simplifies using Ironic root device hints for people who only need
to change the default strategy of selecting the default device.
E.g. we have a use case for selecting the first device instead of the smallest,
so that the root device does not change after upgrade Kilo -> Liberty.

Note that this feature does not replace per-node device hints, rather
complement them with a more global and easy to use setting.

This change introduces 3 new arguments to the command:
--root-device states how to find a root devices for a node.
  If this argument is provided, the client will try to detect the root device
  based on the stored introspection data. Possible values:
  * smallest (the same thing as IPA does by default - the smallest device)
  * largest (the opposite thing - pick the largest device)
  * otherwise it's treated as a comma-separated list of possible device names,
    e.g. sda,vda,hda rouchly matches the logic the Kilo ramdisk used.
  The resulting device WWN or serial (whatever is available) is then recorded
  in the root device hints (/properties/root_device) for a node.
--root-device-minimum-size minimum size of the considered devices
  The default value of 4 GiB matches what IPA does.
--overwrite-root-device-hints allows overwriting root device hints set
  previously. It's disabled by default to allow more precise control over the
  root device for some subset of nodes.

Note that for these arguments to work, this command should be run after
introspection. A separate documentation change will be posted for that.

Closes-Bug: #1588433
Change-Id: I9f19554c5e7f34c8f63c1603c32b4d470fb12592
(cherry picked from commit ceabf658b847f9be6f0115e96a7af86a890ba232)

This is a patch for vlan-aware-vms api for neutron-client.

This contains the create, delete, update, show, and list client APIs for
the new Trunk and Subport API.

    The API syntax is:

    trunk-create

    trunk-list

    trunk-show

    subport-create

    subport-delete

    subport-list

    subport-show

    subport-delete

Note: Use trunk-create to create a trunk before use subport-ceate
      to create a bubport. Subport in the same trunk must have
      different segment-id.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I126885eb71d44f4e6727be113818c5b0841773dd

commit_message:
Adding neutronclient support for vlan-aware-vms functionality.

This is a patch for vlan-aware-vms api for neutron-client.

This contains the create, delete, update, show, and list client APIs for
the new Trunk and Subport API.

Note: Use trunk-create to create a trunk before use subport-ceate
      to create a subport. Subport in the same trunk must have
      different segment-id.

DocImpact: Add neutron trunk and subport api.

Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I126885eb71d44f4e6727be113818c5b0841773dd

commit_message:
fix the description field cannot be updated

when using 'alarm update' cmd to update alarm's field, such as
updating the comparison_operator field of threshold alarm,
although the field is updated successfully, this alarm's
description field cannot be updated according to the lastest
information.

Change-Id: I5536af7234973cf5f55757faafc903027a12dd6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-aodhclient refs/changes/90/322590/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from aodhclient.i18n import _ def update_description(alarm_value): if alarm_value['type'] == 'threshold': return (_('Alarm when %(meter_name)s is ' '%(comparison_operator)s a %(statistic)s ' 'of %(threshold)s over %(period)s seconds') % dict(comparison_operator = alarm_value[ 'threshold_rule']['comparison_operator'], statistic = alarm_value[ 'threshold_rule']['statistic'], threshold = alarm_value[ 'threshold_rule']['threshold'], meter_name = alarm_value[ 'threshold_rule']['meter_name'], period = alarm_value[ 'threshold_rule']['period'])) if alarm_value['type'] == 'event': return (_('Alarm when %s event occurred.') % alarm_value['event_rule']['event_type']) if alarm['type'] in ('threshold','event'): alarm['description'] = update_description(alarm)

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 07:40:26.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/api.py', 'cinder/objects/base.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hpe3par.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e6e2ef4d69854772bda2a456e40093e3f8fc5f34', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I40878c38fd27933d73225ba49bd69b425f13dc6a
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I40878c38fd27933d73225ba49bd69b425f13dc6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/42/337042/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
Add support for OVS patch ports

OVS patch ports are used to connect two OVS bridges so traffic can flow
between them. This is generally useful for various cases.

Specifically it could be used to connect the bridges created by TripleO
networking configurations (br-ex, etc) to the bridge created by the
multinode networking setup in infra's nodepool (br_pub). This allows the
nodes in a multinode deployment to have connectivity across private
subnets where such traffic is typically firewalled off in public clouds.

Change-Id: I11404106cb3f53734f6fc9a35c22f905a0770245
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/39/329539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif obj_type == "ovs_patch_port": return OvsPatchPort.from_json(json) class OvsPatchPort(_BaseOpts): """Base class for OVS Tunnels.""" def __init__(self, name, use_dhcp=False, use_dhcpv6=False, addresses=None, routes=None, mtu=None, primary=False, nic_mapping=None, persist_mapping=False, defroute=True, dhclient_args=None, dns_servers=None, bridge_name=None, peer=None, ovs_options=None, ovs_extra=None): addresses = addresses or [] routes = routes or [] ovs_extra = ovs_extra or [] dns_servers = dns_servers or [] super(OvsPatchPort, self).__init__(name, use_dhcp, use_dhcpv6, addresses, routes, mtu, primary, nic_mapping, persist_mapping, defroute, dhclient_args, dns_servers) self.bridge_name = bridge_name self.peer = peer self.ovs_options = ovs_options or [] self.ovs_extra = ovs_extra or [] @staticmethod def from_json(json): name = _get_required_field(json, 'name', 'OvsPatchPort') bridge_name = _get_required_field(json, 'bridge_name', 'OvsPatchPort') peer = _get_required_field(json, 'peer', 'OvsPatchPort') ovs_options = json.get('ovs_options', []) ovs_options = ['options:%s' % opt for opt in ovs_options] ovs_extra = json.get('ovs_extra', []) opts = _BaseOpts.base_opts_from_json(json) return OvsPatchPort(name, *opts, bridge_name=bridge_name, peer=peer, ovs_options=ovs_options, ovs_extra=ovs_extra)

commit_message:
Support hierarchical project naming

The proposal is to change the name of projects to be their full path, including
the leaf name). In this way, this (full) name will remain unique, while
allowing projects within the hierarchy to have duplicate names (as long as
they have different parents).

Change-Id: Ibee1f9c793a756598014a2e84c7e83c051dab0be
Implements: bp hierarchical-project-naming
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/05/318605/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== Support hierarchical project naming =================================== `bp hierarchical-project-naming <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/hierarchical-project-naming>`_ Provide optional support for hierarchical naming of projects. Problem Description =================== Due to our heritage of a flat tenant model, a project's name must be unique within a domain, regardless of where that project sits in any project hierarchy within that domain. As project hierarchies grow, this will become increasingly untenable. While a longer term goal may be to relex this constraint, this would affect many clients of keystone. An alternative, is therefore being proposed. Proposed Change =============== The proposal is to allow an optional ability to treat the full path of a project (plus its original name) as the project name. In this way, this (full) name will remain unique, while allowing projects within the hierarchy to have duplicate names (as long as they have different parents). For example, two projects called "myproject" could exist in the hierarchy: name1 = development/sas/myproject name2 = development/internal/myproject In Mitaka, we laid the ground work for allowing the specification of a project paths in an API request, by supporting an optional ability to make sure project names are url safe [1]. Deployments that are running with this feature enabled could reliably use hierarchical naming scheme (with a separator that is one of the reserved characters defined in section 2.2 of rfc3986 <http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986>_) to address a project, if we were to provide one. For example: :: { "auth": { "identity": { ... }, "scope": { "project": { "domain": { "name": "acme.com" }, "name": "development/sas/myproject" } } } } It is proposed that we now enable this capability, and at the same time switch to full path naming for all project names. This will be optional, controlled by a configuration option, which by default is disabled. In order for this option to be honored, the deployment must be running with url_safe project naming set to `strict`. The formal definition for the auth request block is that if the `name` starts with the separator, then this is considered a fully qualified path to the project, including the name of the project acting as a domain. If the `name` does not start with the separator, then the name is considered relative to the `domain` specifier. For instance, the following auth block is equivalent to the example above: :: { "auth": { "identity": { ... }, "scope": { "project": { "name": "/acme.com/development/sas/myproject" } } } } In addition to the auth request, the following APIs will return a path-based project name (relative to their domain): - GET /project - GET /projects - GET /auth/projects The V2 API list tenants by tenant name will not support the new capability, although the V2/token auth request by tenant name will support the full path (this is required otherwise it would be impossible to use tenant name to authenticate via V2 since the unqualified tenant name might not be unique in the default domain). Although this new support is optional, the proposal is that, irrespective of the configuration setting, on migration to Newton all project entities have their names updated in the database to be the full path. When such entities are accessed via the API, the manager layer will either use the full path or strip of the parents, depending on the setting of the configuration option. Although ideally once enabled, such configuration options would never be disabled - it is not practical for us to enforce this. It would be possible, therefore, for a deployer to create some projects with non domain-wide unique names, then disable the feature and no longer be able to address some of those projects by name. To aid this situation, an option will be added to keystone-manage that will list any projects that have non-unique names within a domain. The separator used in such path naming will be the forward slash character `/`. It would be possible to make the separator configurable by deployment via a configuration option - however the confusion of having to know the separator for a given cloud (before you authenticate), seems to create a worse problem than simply having a fixed separator in the first place, so it is proposed that we do not allow the separator to be modified. Due to the fact that this is a potentially breaking change to the API (i.e. an working auth request before this change might now fail), this support will only be available with a microversion change. An intended side effect of this new auth capability is that it is now possible to get a project scoped token to a project acting as a domain (this is not possible in the current API). For example to get a project scoped token to the domain called development above, the following auth request could be used: :: { "auth": { "identity": { ... }, "scope": { "project": { "name": "/development" } } } } Such a token would, as per the current specification for tokens, include the `is_domain` attribute set `true`, allowing for policy enforcement on domain operations using project scoped tokens, allowing for the eventual deprecation of domain tokens altogether. Alternatives ------------ We could make this standard within the given microversion, but that would mean that, once we have additional, subsequent, microversions, hierarchical project naming would become mandatory if you wanted any of those later facilities. Data Model Impact ----------------- On migration, the project names will be converted to full path names. To avoid a long migration time, this will be done on-the-fly as projects are accessed, rather than in one go at upgrade time. This on-the-fly migration will be hidden within the sql driver layer. REST API Impact --------------- See Identity specification changes proposed as part of this patch. Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- Whenever we issue notifications that reference a project name, this will be a fully qualified path to the project within the hierarchy. This will only be different to what is included in notifications today if the project is not a top level project. Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: henry-nash Dependencies ============ Microversion support in Keystone, see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315180/ Testing ======= Tempest tests will be provided that ensure introduction of this feature does not break existing expectations of other services. Documentation Impact ==================== Changes to the Identity API to clarify naming. References ========== [1] `url-safe-names <https://github.com/openstack/keystone-specs/blob/master/specs/keystone/mitaka/url-safe-names.rst>_`.

commit_message:
[docs] Revise overview chapter in OSA install guide

1. Tidy up index.rst
2. Move targethosts-network.rst content to overview chapter
3. Move LXC commands section to dev docs
4. Add host layout diagrams
5. Installation workflow section - move Network ranges
subsection to Network Architecture section

Change-Id: Idea40a7d8f4cd9926876a57f7cfb3162c0c7dd82
Implements: blueprint osa-install-guide-overhaul

commit_message:
To prevent update-subnet dns-nameserver concurrently

This patch set added a unique-constraint to prevent two
commands update subnet with difference value dns-nameserver
on *one* subnet at the same time.

Co-Authored-By: Cao Xuan Hoang <HoangCX@vn.fujitsu.com>

Closes-Bug: #1548142
Change-Id: Ic026b29ffcac3fd1b06e8d35efd3e386eb3425c9

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """uniq_subnet_id0order Revision ID: fd8d61ec58a3 Revises: 0e66c5227a8a Create Date: 2016-03-16 10:45:32.458302 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = 'fd8d61ec58a3' down_revision = '0e66c5227a8a' from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa from neutron._i18n import _ from neutron.common import exceptions dnsnameservers = sa.Table( 'dnsnameservers', sa.MetaData(), sa.Column('address', sa.String(128)), sa.Column('subnet_id', sa.String(36)), sa.Column('order', sa.Integer())) class DuplicateDnsnamserverwithsamePriority(exceptions.Conflict): message = _("Dns-nameserver is created with same priority for subnet " "subnet(s). Database cannot be upgraded. Please" "remove all duplicated before upgrading the database") def upgrade(): op.create_unique_constraint( 'uniq_dnsnameserverpriority0subnet_id0order', 'dnsnameservers', ['subnet_id', 'order']) def check_sanity(connection): res = get_duplicate_dnsnameserver_with_same_priority(connection) if res: raise DuplicateDnsnamserverwithsamePriority( dnsnameserver=",".join(res)) def get_duplicate_dnsnameserver_with_same_priority(connection): insp = sa.engine.reflection.Inspector.from_engine(connection) if 'dnsnameservers' not in insp.get_table_names(): return {} session = sa.orm.Session(bind=connection.connect()) query = (session.query(dnsnameservers.c.dnsnameserver) .group_by(dnsnameservers.c.subnet_id, dnsnameservers.c.order) .having(sa.func.count() > 1)).all() return [q[0] for q in query]

commit_message:
Drop IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER_ISCSI_WITH_IPA from documentation

Support of old ramdisk has been deprecated at [0].
This patch removes IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER_ISCSI_WITH_IPA variable
from documentation.

Reference:
[0] https://review.openstack.org/327083/

Change-Id: I37448131b71d8e1580a765096e9d3698bd4b1c6c

commit_message:
Add support for custom YAQL functions

Custom YAQL functions must be added in the 'mistral.yaql_functions'
namespace in the entry points. The entry point name is used as the
function name in YAQL. All of the Mistral YAQL functions have been
changed to a custom functions for the sake of testing.

DocImpact: The developer section in the documention has been updated.

Change-Id: I518c7a4b616089d4b70585ed85fcd81a30c93090
Implements: blueprint mistral-custom-yaql-functions
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/04/334804/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mistral.yaql_functions = json_pp = mistral.utils.yaql_utils:json_pp_

commit_message:
New RPC layer implementation

 * Implemented using kombu library

TODO (next commits):
 - Integrate it with Mistral
 - Make RPC implementation configurable
 - Wrap exceptions
 - Unit tests

Partially implements blueprint mistral-alternative-rpc

Co-Authored-By: Dawid Deja <dawid.deja@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ie7db5cce0c1fd6074d4f866b6c3ee1d008614355

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 - Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslo.config import cfg from mistral.engine.rpc_direct import base as rpc_base from mistral.tests.unit.engine import base class RPCTest(base.EngineTestCase): def setUp(self): super(RPCTest, self).setUp() def test_get_rpc_config(self): conf = cfg.CONF config = rpc_base.get_rpc_config_from_oslo(conf.engine) self.assertDictEqual( { 'topic': 'mistral_engine', 'rabbit_port': 5672, 'server_id': '0.0.0.0', 'user_id': 'guest', 'virtual_host': '/', 'rabbit_host': 'localhost', 'exchange': 'openstack', 'password': 'guest' }, config )

subject: Adds migrated API reference files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-04 02:58:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/497541e48b204204b6181a401f3a6c3d2fd98200', 'message': 'Adds migrated API reference files

With this email[0], you can now migrate API reference docs into RST.

Also copies the sphinx extension from nova into tree, which
will be later split into its own python module. At that time, cut
over to the module and drop it from the project tree.

The conf.py and the tox environment are also cribbed from nova.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/093765.html

Change-Id: Ifebc65b188c4f2ba35b61c0deae5ec24401df7f9

commit_message:
Adds migrated API reference files

This brings in RST plus YAML files, migrated from the source for [0].

The migration explanation is found on the openstack-dev mailing list [1].

Project instruction is in the OpenStack Documentation Contributor Guide [2].

A patch for publishing this source is in [3].

The conf.py and the tox environment are standard across other projects.

[0]http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-objectstorage-v1.html
[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/093765.html
[2]http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/api-guides.html
[3]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313015/

Change-Id: Ifebc65b188c4f2ba35b61c0deae5ec24401df7f9

added_lines: [testenv:api-ref] # This environment is called from CI scripts to test and publish # the API Ref to developer.openstack.org. # NOTE(sdague): this target does not use constraints because # upstream infra does not yet support it. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. # # we do not use -W here because we are doing some slightly tricky # things to build a single page document, and as such, we are ok # ignoring the duplicate stanzas warning. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages} commands = rm -rf api-ref/build sphinx-build -W -b html -d api-ref/build/doctrees api-ref/source api-ref/build/html

find_test_caller is now moved from misc to test_utils, but there
are still some calling to find_test_caller which will cause "WARNING
tempest.lib.common.utils.misc [-] tempest.lib.common.utils.misc.

Change-Id: Icbd4c7a45677b4bb031fc40d6b47dd6a72af6f02
'}]
commit_message:
Use find_test_caller in test_utils instead of in misc

find_test_caller is now moved from misc to test_utils, but there
are still some calling to find_test_caller which will cause "WARNING
tempest.lib.common.utils.misc [-] tempest.lib.common.utils.misc.
find_test_caller is deprecated in favor of tempest.lib.common.
utils.test_utils.find_test_caller".

Change-Id: Icbd4c7a45677b4bb031fc40d6b47dd6a72af6f02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/60/336460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utils caller = test_utils.find_test_caller() caller = test_utils.find_test_caller()
deleted_lines: from tempest.lib.common.utils import misc as misc_utils caller = misc_utils.find_test_caller() caller = misc_utils.find_test_caller()

commit_message:
Handle catalog backends that don't support all functions.

Using the templated backend for catalogs deleting a project
will currently work but it will return an error to the user
that is raised in the delete notification code handling.

Change-Id: Ie2ecb226389a7ee74dc64b28b0e08817e6375801
Closes-Bug: #1579604

commit_message:
Add atop configuration settings

Now the atop setting are configurable from UI and can be overriden in
hiera. Also, this change adds idempotency and fix noop tests.

DocImpact
Depends-On: Ie0e69f58183193455d5d036b45668a3476f1a693
Change-Id: I59cea9ea5ca31c20db2cf3eaaebe09bad0abdcf8
Closes-Bug: #1597250
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add pymod2pkg v0.4.0

Change-Id: Iefbfae905d02b34f18e80a19cf9dc0126a2ee148
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/27/330527/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %global sname pymod2pkg Name: {{ py2name('pymod2pkg') }} Version: 0.4.0 Release: 0 Summary: OpenStack Packaging - python module name to package name map License: {{ license('Apache-2.0') }} Group: Development/Libraries/Python Url: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Rpm-packaging Source0: https://pypi.io/packages/source/p/%{sname}/%{sname}-%{version}.tar.gz BuildRequires: openstack-macros BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('devel') }} BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('flake8') }} BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('pbr') }} BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('testrepository') }} BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('testscenarios') }} BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('testtools') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('pbr') }} BuildArch: noarch %description pymod2pkg is a simple python module for translating python module names to corresponding package names which is a common problem in the packaging world. %package doc Summary: Documentation for python module name to package name map library BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('Sphinx') }} BuildRequires: {{ py2pkg('oslosphinx') }} %description doc Documentation for python module name to package name map library. %prep %setup -q -n %{sname}-%{version} rm -rf %{sname}.egg-info %build %{__python2} setup.py build # generate html docs %{__python2} setup.py build_sphinx # remove the sphinx-build leftovers rm -rf doc/build/html/.{doctrees,buildinfo} %install %{__python2} setup.py install --skip-build --root %{buildroot} %check export PYTHONPATH="%{python2_sitelib}:%{buildroot}%{python2_sitelib}" %{__python2} setup.py test %files %doc README* LICENSE %{python2_sitelib}/%{sname}* %{python2_sitelib}/*.egg-info %files doc %doc doc/build/html %license LICENSE %changelog

subject: Align project files structure with cookiecutter template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-29 07:39:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/22bf81cbe4d7dd53bead4ffd932a514b0e3c1a37', 'message': "Align project files structure with cookiecutter template

1.What is the problem
An OpenStack project should be created based on the template
generated by cookiecutter:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#preparing-a-new-git-repository-using-cookiecutter

There are some files missing in the Tricircle compared to
the files generated from cookiecutter template.

2.What's need to be fixed:
This patches is to amend this missing files.

Moreover, the installation of DevStack should be moved to the
documentation part which are located in doc/source folder.
Therefore the README.md in the Tricircle root folder is refactoryed
and only the description of the Tricircle are remained, and the
DevStack installation is moved to the doc/source/installation.rst.

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
Make the Tricircle align to other OpenStack project folder structure
template which could be generated from cookiecutter

commit_message:
Align project files structure with cookiecutter template

1.What is the problem
An OpenStack project should be created based on the template
generated by cookiecutter: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#preparing-a-new-git-repository-using-cookiecutter

There are some files missing in the Tricircle compared to
the files generated by cookiecutter template.

2.What's need to be fixed:
This patch sets is to amend this missing files.

Moreover, README.md was renamed to README.rst, and the installation
part with devstack was moved to doc/source/installation.rst according
to the cookiecutter generated template. The README.rst in the
Tricircle root folder was updated accordingly, and only the description
of the Tricircle was remained.

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
To make the Tricircle follow other OpenStack project folder structure
template which could be generated by cookiecutter to keep consistency.

Change-Id: I65d4c376a87eccded12bd3f08bcd9ee89def95d4
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/48/335348/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move _RESOURCE_KEYS down to class level

This will make it possible to find resource keys without having to
reference a specific template format module.

Change-Id: I1a2b3e36ecd20100c316ba9b2ce19aabe9c9ef70

commit_message:
Add default release names for template versions

Release version names are easier for template authors to remember than
seemingly arbitrary dates. It should also make it clearer to new Heat
users that heat_template_version is not like a BIND zone file version
(which would be incremented with each version of the template).

Change-Id: Iae9b6a676702b2a115b18fdfb1ab2afbe5faacde
blueprint support-alias-for-heat-template-version-names

commit_message:
Use openstack commands for prepare_test_network.sh

There is not yet an openstack command to create a subnet so the old
command is used.

The tests work fine without adding the ROUTER_GW_IP route, so this has
been removed.

Change-Id: Ic5f9c3ab130ad089fb12a7f2182dc8136faa6daf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/72/335272/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -ex HEAT_PRIVATE_SUBNET_CIDR=10.0.5.0/24ROUTER_GW_IP=$(openstack subnet show public-subnet --format value --column gateway_ip) sudo route add -net $HEAT_PRIVATE_SUBNET_CIDR gw $ROUTER_GW_IPopenstack network create heat-netopenstack router add subnet router1 heat-subnet
deleted_lines: set -x PUB_SUBNET_ID=`neutron subnet-list | grep ' public-subnet ' | awk '{split($0,a,"|"); print a[2]}'` ROUTER_GW_IP=`neutron port-list -c fixed_ips -c device_owner | grep router_gateway | awk -F '"' -v subnet_id="${PUB_SUBNET_ID//[[:space:]]/}" '$4 == subnet_id { print $8; }'`HEAT_PRIVATE_SUBNET_CIDR=10.0.5.0/24 neutron net-create heat-netneutron router-interface-add router1 heat-subnet sudo route add -net $HEAT_PRIVATE_SUBNET_CIDR gw $ROUTER_GW_IP

commit_message:
template show api documentation

Change-Id: I40546a047f84cfc7a3a7ce14495ed411debd7bc7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/19/337019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================================== Template Show ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Shows the template body by given template ID GET /v1/template/[template_uuid] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Headers ======= - User-Agent (string) - X-Auth-Token (string, required) - Keystone auth token - Accept (string) - application/json Path Parameters =============== - template uuid Query Parameters ================ None Request Body ============ None. Request Examples ================ :: GET /v1/template/a0bdb89a-fe4c-4b27-adc2-507b7ec44c24 Host: 135.248.19.18:8999 User-Agent: keystoneauth1/2.3.0 python-requests/2.9.1 CPython/2.7.6 X-Auth-Token: 2b8882ba2ec44295bf300aecb2caa4f7 Accept: application/json Response Status code ==================== - 200 - OK - 404 - failed to show template with uuid: [template_uuid] Response Body ============= Returns a JSON object which represents the template body Response Examples ================= :: { "scenarios": [ { "scenario": { "actions": [ { "action": { "action_target": { "target": "instance" }, "properties": { "alarm_name": "exploding_world", "severity": "CRITICAL" }, "action_type": "raise_alarm" } } ], "condition": "alarm_1_on_host and host_contains_instance" } }, { "scenario": { "actions": [ { "action": { "action_target": { "source": "alarm_1", "target": "alarm_2" }, "action_type": "add_causal_relationship" } } ], "condition": "alarm_1_on_host and alarm_2_on_instance and host_contains_instance" } } ], "definitions": { "relationships": [ { "relationship": { "relationship_type": "on", "source": "alarm_1", "target": "host", "template_id": "alarm_1_on_host" } }, { "relationship": { "relationship_type": "on", "source": "alarm_2", "target": "instance", "template_id": "alarm_2_on_instance" } }, { "relationship": { "relationship_type": "contains", "source": "host", "target": "instance", "template_id": "host_contains_instance" } } ], "entities": [ { "entity": { "category": "ALARM", "type": "nagios", "name": "check_libvirtd", "template_id": "alarm_1" } }, { "entity": { "category": "RESOURCE", "type": "nova.host", "template_id": "host" } }, { "entity": { "category": "RESOURCE", "type": "nova.instance", "template_id": "instance" } }, { "entity": { "category": "ALARM", "type": "vitrage", "name": "exploding_world", "template_id": "alarm_2" } } ] }, "metadata": { "name": "first_deduced_alarm_ever" }

commit_message:
Reuse common code in securitygroups_rpc module

Code in prepare_devices_filter() and refresh_firewall() is almost
common. So move common code into a separate function and call that
from these functions.

Change-Id: I2a0ad4aeb3cc4e0f484ca1ee316bf0b614a3b72f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/06/337106/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._apply_port_filter(device_ids) def _apply_port_filter(self, device_ids, update_filter=False): if update_filter: LOG.debug("Update port filter for %s", device['device']) self.firewall.update_port_filter(device) else: LOG.debug("Prepare port filter for %s", device['device']) self.firewall.prepare_port_filter(device) self._apply_port_filter(device_ids, update_filter=True)
deleted_lines: self.firewall.prepare_port_filter(device) if self.use_enhanced_rpc: devices_info = self.plugin_rpc.security_group_info_for_devices( self.context, device_ids) devices = devices_info['devices'] security_groups = devices_info['security_groups'] security_group_member_ips = devices_info['sg_member_ips'] else: devices = self.plugin_rpc.security_group_rules_for_devices( self.context, device_ids) with self.firewall.defer_apply(): if self.use_enhanced_rpc: LOG.debug("Update security group information for ports %s", devices.keys()) self._update_security_group_info( security_groups, security_group_member_ips) for device in devices.values(): LOG.debug("Update port filter for %s", device['device']) self.firewall.update_port_filter(device)

commit_message:
Add install-guide for ceilometer

This adds ceilometer-specific contents of the OpenStack Installation Guide
in the ceilometer repo per [1]. A separate change will remove the
ceilometer contents from the OpenStack Installation Guide for Newton per [2].

The ceilometer install-guide structure is based on Install Guide
Cookiecutter [3].

Also adds tox.ini environment for install-guide and adds
openstackdocs-theme to test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/newton/project-specific-installguides.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/newton/installguide.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314229/

Partially-Implements: blueprint projectspecificinstallguide
Change-Id: Iffc5d7243e9eeb74c9dd7b559ef3de7123269293
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/51/330051/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:install-guide] # NOTE(jaegerandi): this target does not use constraints because # upstream infra does not yet support it. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages} commands = sphinx-build -a -E -W -d install-guide/build/doctrees -b html install-guide/source install-guide/build/html

commit_message:
Use the disk size as the osd weight when osd_initial_weight is auto

In most of case, the disks used by ceph have different size. Use the
default value 1 may block the ceph when one disk is full. Use the disk
size as osd weight will more reasonally.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib875c7289188cbb9380355baf0c8048f1eb09332
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/95/331395/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "${OSD_INITIAL_WEIGHT}" == "auto" ]]; then OSD_INITIAL_WEIGHT=$(parted ${OSD_PARTITION} unit GB print | awk 'match($0, /^Disk.* (.*)GB/, a) { print a[1]}') fi

commit_message:
Define api test in tox.ini

This patch defines 'api' test which is based on tempest
in tox.ini. User can perform tempest API test locally by
running 'tox -eapi'. It also fixes an error in README
file for tempest test.

Change-Id: If005adc03606198383e6b9fe38ecc8b8ffee02cc

commit_message:
Refactoring: remove the duplicate method

The method `assertTimestampEqual` which compare two ISO 8601 format
time can be used across the testcases, so move the method to core.py
and remove the duplicate method.

Change-Id: I7bd34380f87da0ee8a52af228f1cf966d90b33c8
Related-Bug: #1598040
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/63/336963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO(davechen): This method is copied from `keystone.tests.unit. # test_v3_auth.TokenAPITests`, move this method into utils.py to avoid # the duplication? def assertTimestampEqual(self, expected, value): # Compare two timestamps but ignore the microseconds part # of the expected timestamp. Keystone does not track microseconds and # is working to eliminate microseconds from it's datetimes used. expected = timeutils.parse_isotime(expected).replace(microsecond=0) value = timeutils.parse_isotime(value).replace(microsecond=0) self.assertEqual( expected, value, "%s != %s" % (expected, value))

commit_message:
Add support for user-provided ceph config

Adds a new config-flags option to the charm that
supports setting a dictionary of ceph configuration
settings that will be applied to ceph.conf.

This implementation supports config sections so that
settings can be applied to any section supported by
the ceph.conf template in the charm.

Includes some unit test code cleanup.

Closes-Bug: 1522375
Change-Id: I5fa0890d87425499dbd48af6f2bc1f196713a975

payload-vip-delete

Change-Id: Idbb032585e7a187f686b0818e3c5cb281a63dc4f
Implements: blueprint payload-vip-delete
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/50/322950/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= The title of your blueprint ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/payload-vip-delete Modify existing payload for loadbalancer.delete.start event, which is raised when a LBaaS vip is deleted Right now we have only loadbalanbcer id in the payload for this event through designate sink. Problem description =================== At present we dont have enough information in the event payload to automate functionality in Desingate such are deleting records that are associated with the Loadbalancer. Any customization on Desingate end would require enough information such as LoadBalancer name, tenant info etc. Proposed change =============== We would like to add few more extra parameters such are tenant information and loadbalancer information in the existing payload. This information will be lost once the loadbalancer is deleted and hence not possible to retrive. If we can passs this information with the loadbalancer.delete.start as a payload we would be able to do any postprocessing with that information. API Changes ----------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Kumar Acharya<ma501v> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Newton

subject: base.Resource not define __ne__() built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 06:50:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient/commit/ee183b954c50394776fddc14af0500c31fbbebae', 'message': 'base.Resource not define __ne__() built-in function

Class base.Resource defines __eq__() built-in function, but does
not define __ne__() built-in function, so self.assertEqual works
but self.assertNotEqual does not work at all in this test case in
python2. This patch fixes it by defining __eq__() built-in function
of class base.Resource. Also fixes spelling errors:resoruces.

Change-Id: I13ed9ddd6ae6ef074232b33695916bc83930dcf0

commit_message:
base.Resource not define __ne__() built-in function

Class base.Resource defines __eq__() built-in function, but does
not define __ne__() built-in function, so self.assertEqual works
but self.assertNotEqual does not work at all in this test case in
python2. This patch fixes it by defining __eq__() built-in function
of class base.Resource.

Change-Id: I13ed9ddd6ae6ef074232b33695916bc83930dcf0
Closes-Bug: #1586268
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/31/337031/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): if not isinstance(other, Resource): return NotImplemented # two resources of different types are not equal if not isinstance(other, self.__class__): return True return self._info != other._info

commit_message:
Replace raw_input with input to make PY3 compatible

The raw_input() raises NameError: name 'raw_input' is not defined in
python3. This patch fixes it by replacing raw_input with input to make
PY3 compatible.

Change-Id: I03f38e23794807c572ccde0001b3e24c8a2c3407
Closes-Bug: #1595827

commit_message:
Make help string more accurate for rest notifier

According to request documentation, the config option of
rest_notifier_certificate_key should mean the file containing the private
key, not the key itself.

Change-Id: I0ce5aebc526909164b2f8f25767bc5b72da73ff5

commit_message:
Return `revoked_at` for list revoke events

The field will help to figure out when the event is recorded, and thus
give a clue on when the revocation was done.

Change-Id: If5ba3bb9b68fff5f35be2b57af15584d69c6df8d
Closes-Bug: #1598040

commit_message:
Correct 400 Bad request error in RolesTestJSON

When deleting resources in teardown_all, resource body is used
instead of resource id, so 400 Bad request error is raised.
This is to correct this.

Change-Id: I4675b44f1bfd7a95ec5b68fa316a5b819aa9eb7f
Closes-Bug: #1597164

commit_message:
freezer client report "Unauthorized" error when backup data to swift.
The ENV vars "OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME" and "OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME" have not been provided to swift client when create_swift in Class OSClientManager.(source code: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/openstack/osclients.py)

Change-Id: I24fb674e6eb7077ea77ce2a88f19c6535288b3c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/82/337082/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

(deployment_tasks.yaml) early before it have been delivered

commit_message:
This test for deployment task history feature.

Test scenario:
            1. Revert snapshot ready with 3 slaves
            2. Create cluster with one controller node
            3. Deploy cluster
            4. Get the deployment graph on fuel master node.
            5. Add one more controller node and redeploy the cluster.
            6. Get the redeployment graph on fuel master node.
            7. Compare deployment tasks history and deployment graph.
            8. Compare redeployment tasks history and redeployment graph.

Closes bug: 1587385

Change-Id: If8d536de37ef77e537c2faa258226609dd6f0b84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/10/323410/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from devops.error import TimeoutError from devops.helpers.helpers import wait from proboscis import test from proboscis.asserts import assert_equal from proboscis.asserts import assert_false from proboscis.asserts import assert_true from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test.helpers.utils import generate_floating_ranges from fuelweb_test.settings import DEPLOYMENT_MODE from fuelweb_test.settings import SSL_CN from fuelweb_test.settings import PATH_TO_PEM from fuelweb_test.settings import NEUTRON_SEGMENT_TYPE from fuelweb_test.settings import NEUTRON_SEGMENT from fuelweb_test.settings import OPENSTACK_RELEASE from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import TestBasic from fuelweb_test.tests import test_cli_base from fuelweb_test import logger @test(groups=["deployment_task_history"]) class DeploymentTaskHistory(TestBasic): """DeploymentTaskHistory""" # TODO documentation @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_3], groups=["deployment_task_history"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def deployment_task_history(self): """Deploy cluster with controller node only Scenario: 1. Revert snapshot ready with 3 slaves 2. Create cluster with one controller node 3. Deploy cluster 4. Get the deployment graph on fuel master node. 5. Add one more controller node and redeploy the cluster. 6. Get the redeployment graph on fuel master node. 7. Compare deployment tasks history and deployment graph. 8. Compare redeployment tasks history and redeployment graph. Duration 20m """ self.show_step(1) self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_3_slaves") self.show_step(2) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__ ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, {'slave-01': ['controller']} ) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(4) controller_ip = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, ['controller'])[0]['ip'] cmd =\ 'fuel2 graph download --env {}' \ ' --all --type default --file deployment_graph.yaml &&' \ ' cat deployment_graph.yaml'.format(cluster_id) self.ssh_manager.execute_on_remote(controller_ip, cmd, yamlify=True) admin_ip = self.ssh_manager.admin_ip

commit_message:
Increase verbosity of the timesync exception messages

Add more details to the exception messages that could help to
find the root cause of failed time sync.

Change-Id: I3aa063271f8b9e4c04d5963bfd981388f811af11
Closes-Bug:#1582812
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/25/317625/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """IP of a server from which the time will be synchronized""" @abc.abstractproperty def last_error_msg(self): """Last error message, empty string by default""" self.__last_error_msg = '' def last_error_msg(self): return self.__last_error_msg @last_error_msg.setter def last_error_msg(self, msg): self.__last_error_msg = msg @property except TimeoutError: result = self.remote.execute(cmd) self.last_error_msg = ( "Execution of the command '{cmd}' failed on the node " "{node_name} with exit_code = {ec} : {stderr}" .format(cmd=cmd, node_name=self.node_name, ec=result['exit_code'], stderr='\n'.join(result['stderr']))) logger.debug(self.last_error_msg) if self.is_synchronized: self.remote.execute('hwclock -w') self.last_error_msg = '' # self.peers = `ntpq -pn 127.0.0.1` self.last_error_msg = "Node: {0}, ntpd peers: {1}".format( self.node_name, self.peers) logger.debug(self.last_error_msg) self.last_error_msg = '' return [(ntp.node_name, ntp.last_error_msg, ntp.date) return [(ntp.node_name, ntp.last_error_msg, ntp.peers)

added_lines: local timeouts_attr_name=$2 ocf_run attrd_updater -p --name $timeouts_attr_name --update 0 count=`attrd_updater --name $timeouts_attr_name --query 2>/dev/null` # the attrd_updater exited with error. In that case most probably it printed garbage # As a result, $timeouts_attr_name's value will be one less than it should be. But we don't need ocf_run attrd_updater -p --name $timeouts_attr_name --update $count if ! is-cluster-status-ok ; then rc=$OCF_ERR_GENERIC fi ocf-update-attr() { local attr_name="${1:?}" local attr_value="{2:?}" ocf_run attrd_updater -p --name "$attr_name" --update "$attr_value" } rabbitmqctl-with-timeout-check() { local command="${1:?}" local timeout_attr_name="${2:?}" su_rabbit_cmd "${OCF_RESKEY_ctl} $command" local rc=$? check_timeouts $rc $timeout_attr_name "$command" local has_timed_out=$? case "$has_timed_out" in 0) return $rc;; 1) return 0;; 2) return 1;; esac } is-cluster-status-ok() { local LH="${LH}: is-cluster-status-ok:" rabbitmqctl-with-timeout-check cluster_status rabbit_cluster_status_timeouts > /dev/null 2>&1 } local attrs_to_zero="rabbit_list_channels_timeouts rabbit_get_alarms_timeouts rabbit_list_queues_timeouts rabbit_cluster_status_timeouts" local attr_name_to_reset for attr_name_to_reset in $attrs_to_zero; do ocf-update-attr $attr_name_to_reset 0 done

In that case most probably it printed garbage # As a result, $crm_attr_name's value will be one less than it should be. But we don't need ocf_run crm_attribute -N $THIS_PCMK_NODE -l reboot --name $crm_attr_name --update $count ocf_run crm_attribute -N $THIS_PCMK_NODE -l reboot --name 'rabbit_list_channels_timeouts' --update '0' ocf_run crm_attribute -N $THIS_PCMK_NODE -l reboot --name 'rabbit_get_alarms_timeouts' --update '0' ocf_run crm_attribute -N $THIS_PCMK_NODE -l reboot --name 'rabbit_list_queues_timeouts' --update '0'
