commit_message:
Added Sphinx-based documentation framework and specs repo.

All of openstack's documentation infrastructure is run via sphinx, including
templates, html parsing, uploading, and more. Thus it behooves us to keep
our javascript documentation build as similar as possible. Since we want to
avoid using tox, and littering the project with pythonic artifacts, we're
instead using Sphinx' own recommended build method: A Makefile.

This patch adds a small but complete documentation tree for this project,
including the build tools needed to create it. It satisfies the need for
narrative documentation, but does not (yet) satisfy the need for code
doc generation. It also includes a section for specifications, as this
effort is not yet large enough to warrant its own specification repo.

Code documentation will need to be added in a subsequent patch, using
Sphinx' jsdoc plugins.

Change-Id: I40eab962d4e4c6eafd1b1499bb00e6af5d72ede0

It is very likely that work is already in progress, however contributions and reviews are always welcome. .. If you add additional projects to this list, please update the gerrit query block. .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 1 Gerrit query for all changes related to priority efforts:: status:open AND project:openstack/js-openstack-lib https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+AND+project:openstack/js-openstack-lib,n,z Approved Specifications ======================= These are specifications that have been approved; work may or may not have started on these. Reviewers will review related changes as time permits. .. toctree:: :glob: :maxdepth: 1 Implemented Specifications ========================== These specifications have already been implemented and are listed here for historical purposes. .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 1

commit_message:
Add CR patchs for octane

For enhancement of development and testing process it is necessary
to add an ability to patch octane code inside fuel from gerrit review.

Change-Id: Id9ed02930d84a0c7ba8f42d5dced77c86ca84d00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/80/335380/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if os.environ.get('OCTANE_PATCHES'): cmd = "curl -o /tmp/octane_patches http://paste.openstack.org/raw/516178/ && sh /tmp/octane_patches {}".format(os.environ.get('OCTANE_PATCHES')) run_on_remote(self.admin_remote, cmd)

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I1e1865dfcd76eb7f06dd28a5b3b401c5625fcdde
Closes-Bug: #1552251
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/83/310483/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import warningstry: html_last_updated_fmt = subprocess.Popen( git_cmd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()[0] except Exception: warnings.warn('Cannot get last updated time from git repository. ' 'Not setting "html_last_updated_fmt".')

commit_message:
Fix wrong watermark state during live migration

From the beginning info.data_remaining is equal to 0.
Watermark has been set by this value. But in future it is get
updated only if it is None or data_processed is less then
watermark. So it remains unchanged.

Change-Id: I9e3917abf572cf6d3401fd5e65be973c576cafe6
Closes-Bug: #1499449

commit_message:
Tuneup gabbi search.yaml file to modern standards

Make use of METHOD: /url shorthand to make the request method more
visible and more tightly associated with the url for easier reading.

Change-Id: Iec90797f1a6dbe427f534808378d86a1f185051f

commit_message:
Replace raw_input with input to make PY3 compatible

The raw_input() raises NameError: name 'raw_input' is not defined in
python3. This patch fixes it by replacing raw_input with input to make
PY3 compatible.

Change-Id: Ieb4c2e5c94fdeb2e69b070e363f92d5c8a736413
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-analytics refs/changes/42/337142/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Tuneup gabbi transformedids.yaml file to modern standards
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 07:27:01.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/gabbi/gabbits/transformedids.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/72c8b5f4a705abe3293a2c323777344b53ebe4f4', 'message': "Tuneup gabbi transformedids.yaml file to modern standards

Make use of METHOD: /url shorthand to make the request method more
visible and more tightly associated with the url for easier reading.

Use $LAST_URL to refer to the URL of the previous request, but only
when the sameness of the URL is a relevant part of the expression of
the tests-in-sequence. (That is, don't just use LAST_URL because the
URL is the same.)

Change-Id: I1a86fcf07faa65f2e554c7278841abcd8870f2c5
"}]
commit_message:
Tuneup gabbi transformedids.yaml file to modern standards

Make use of METHOD: /url shorthand to make the request method more
visible and more tightly associated with the url for easier reading.

Use $LAST_URL to refer to the URL of the previous request, but only
when the sameness of the URL is a relevant part of the expression of
the tests-in-sequence. (That is, don't just use LAST_URL because the
URL is the same.)

Change-Id: I1a86fcf07faa65f2e554c7278841abcd8870f2c5

commit_message:
libvirt: Move enumeration of ephemerals into a separate function

Change-Id: I6c3c2f205d3383d79cfe22876d61d4c57621ae9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/333983/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_ephemeral_disks(self, context, instance, disk_mapping, block_device_info, fallback=None): """A generator which yields all ephemeral disks for an instance. :param context: Request context. :param instance: The instance we are getting ephemeral disks for. :param disk_mapping: mapping from disk_info. :param block_device_info: block_device_info. :param fallback: A compute host to side-load backing files from if they are missing. :return: All ephemeral disks. :rtype: generator of imagecache.Image """ # Lookup the filesystem type if required os_type_with_default = disk_api.get_fs_type_for_os_type( instance.os_type) # Generate a file extension based on the file system # type and the mkfs commands configured if any file_extension = disk_api.get_file_extension_for_os_type( os_type_with_default) if 'disk.local' in disk_mapping: ephemeral_gb = instance.ephemeral_gb fn = functools.partial(self._create_ephemeral, ephemeral_size=ephemeral_gb, fs_label='ephemeral0', os_type=instance.os_type) fname = "ephemeral_%s_%s" % (ephemeral_gb, file_extension) size = ephemeral_gb * units.Gi disk = self.image_backend.from_func(instance, 'disk.local', context, fn, fname, size, fallback=fallback) yield disk for idx, eph in enumerate(driver.block_device_info_get_ephemerals( block_device_info)): specified_fs = eph.get('guest_format') if specified_fs and not self.is_supported_fs_format(specified_fs): msg = _("%s format is not supported") % specified_fs raise exception.InvalidBDMFormat(details=msg) fn = functools.partial(self._create_ephemeral, ephemeral_size=eph['size'], specified_fs=specified_fs, fs_label='ephemeral%d' % idx, os_type=instance.os_type) size = eph['size'] * units.Gi fname = "ephemeral_%s_%s" % (eph['size'], file_extension) disk = self.image_backend.from_func(instance, blockinfo.get_eph_disk(idx), context, fn, fname, size, fallback=fallback) yield disk for eph_disk in self._get_ephemeral_disks(context, instance, disk_mapping, block_device_info, fallback=fallback_from_host): eph_disk.create()
deleted_lines: # Lookup the filesystem type if required os_type_with_default = disk_api.get_fs_type_for_os_type( instance.os_type) # Generate a file extension based on the file system # type and the mkfs commands configured if any file_extension = disk_api.get_file_extension_for_os_type( os_type_with_default) ephemeral_gb = instance.ephemeral_gb if 'disk.local' in disk_mapping: fn = functools.partial(self._create_ephemeral, ephemeral_size=ephemeral_gb, fs_label='ephemeral0', os_type=instance.os_type) fname = "ephemeral_%s_%s" % (ephemeral_gb, file_extension) size = ephemeral_gb * units.Gi from_func('disk.local', fn, fname, size).create() for idx, eph in enumerate(driver.block_device_info_get_ephemerals( block_device_info)): specified_fs = eph.get('guest_format') if specified_fs and not self.is_supported_fs_format(specified_fs): msg = _("%s format is not supported") % specified_fs raise exception.InvalidBDMFormat(details=msg) fn = functools.partial(self._create_ephemeral, ephemeral_size=eph['size'], specified_fs=specified_fs, fs_label='ephemeral%d' % idx, os_type=instance.os_type) size = eph['size'] * units.Gi fname = "ephemeral_%s_%s" % (eph['size'], file_extension) from_func(blockinfo.get_eph_disk(idx), fn, fname, size).create()

commit_message:
libvirt: Move local root disk fetch into a separate function

Change-Id: I514e5913c7b9c72570071b7b095c679f6e3c1539
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/82/333982/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_local_root_disk(self, context, instance, disk_mapping, image_id=None, rescue=False, fallback=None): """Get the local root disk, or None if the instance boots from volume. The returned root disk can be created with create(). :param context: Request context. :param instance: The instance whose root disk we are getting. :param disk_mapping: mapping from disk_info. :param image_id: Optionally a glance image to use. Will use instance.image_ref by default. :param rescue: True if the root disk is for a rescue instance, otherwise False. :param fallback: A compute host to side-load the image from if it has been delete from glance. :return: An Image object. The returned disk has not been created. :rtype: imagebackend.Image """ if self._is_booted_from_volume(instance, disk_mapping): return None if image_id is None: image_id = instance.image_ref name = 'disk' if rescue: name = rescue_name(name) size = instance.root_gb * units.Gi if rescue or size == 0: size = None return self.image_backend.from_image( instance, name, context, image_id, size, fallback=fallback) disk_images={}, network_info=None, root_disk = self._get_local_root_disk( context, instance, disk_mapping, disk_images.get('image_id'), rescue=rescue, fallback=fallback_from_host) if root_disk is not None: if CONF.libvirt.virt_type == 'uml': libvirt_utils.chown(root_disk.path, 'root')
deleted_lines: disk_images=None, network_info=None, booted_from_volume = self._is_booted_from_volume( instance, disk_mapping) def from_image(name, image_id, size, image_type=None): return self.image_backend.from_image( instance, name + suffix, context, image_id, size, fallback=fallback_from_host, image_type=image_type) if not disk_images: disk_images = {'image_id': instance.image_ref} # NOTE(ndipanov): Even if disk_mapping was passed in, which # currently happens only on rescue - we still don't want to # create a base image. if not booted_from_volume: size = instance.root_gb * units.Gi if size == 0 or suffix == '.rescue': size = None root_disk = from_image('disk', disk_images['image_id'], size) if CONF.libvirt.virt_type == 'uml': libvirt_utils.chown(image('disk').path, 'root')

delete event payload

This fix will allow the delete event to have the required data
in the notification payload

Closes-Bug: 1593127

Change-Id: Id151f24d750099f8ffc75315c65cf67076f3a31d

commit_message:
Stop relying on global CONF object

The conf object is now prepared on demand by panko.service.prepare_service.

Change-Id: I3526e73f8acbcb089d42850c0762305a08726db7

subject: Remove manual creation of console.log
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-07 09:43:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ea3904b168e4360b6c68464dbcd0585987b27e91', 'message': "Remove manual creation of console.log

libvirt will automatically create a configured console log when it
starts a guest. However, the libvirt driver manually creates
console.log in 2 places: _create_image and pre_live_migration.

console.log creation was added to _create_image in commit 58e18861,
which was before gerrit. The reason in the commit message is:

  Create console.log ahead of time. This ensures that the user running
  nova-compute maintains read privileges.

This was later patched to fixup permissions if _create_image runs
again, because libvirt chowns it when it runs. Additionally, code has
been added at the point of use, get_console_output, to chown it
immediately before trying to read it. I believe this last case is the
only relevant one here. As this seems to obsolete the original patch,
we remove it.

The change to pre_live_migration came in change If7abd63a. The
specific reason for adding it is not given in the commit message, but
there is a code comment: 'Touch the console.log file, required by
libvirt'. I don't believe this is the case, so we remove it.

Change-Id: Ia84579b84105e8ad6146591188a96e847e762c77
"}]
commit_message:
Remove manual creation of console.log

libvirt will automatically create a configured console log when it
starts a guest. However, the libvirt driver manually creates
console.log in 2 places: _create_image and pre_live_migration.

console.log creation was added to _create_image in commit 58e18861,
which was before gerrit. The reason in the commit message is:

  Create console.log ahead of time. This ensures that the user running
  nova-compute maintains read privileges.

This was later patched to fixup permissions if _create_image runs
again, because libvirt chowns it when it runs. Additionally, code has
been added at the point of use, get_console_output, to chown it
immediately before trying to read it. I believe this last case is the
only relevant one here. As this seems to obsolete the original patch,
we remove it.

The change to pre_live_migration came in change If7abd63a. The
specific reason for adding it is not given in the commit message, but
there is a code comment: 'Touch the console.log file, required by
libvirt'. I don't believe this is the case, so we remove it.

Change-Id: Ia84579b84105e8ad6146591188a96e847e762c77

commit_message:
Huawei: Backend capabilies report optimization

Huawei backend reporting capabilities optimize. Huawei backend
reporting capabilities will be changed when huawei array License
is the failure. Driver will modify the processing module on the
create\manage\migrate\retype and so on. We will output the array
does not support this feature in the log file.

Change-Id: I19968d15c12c43c23eb0a6a2479566ed8b4191d6
Implements: blueprint huawei-backend-capabilities-report-optimization

commit_message:
Document the expectations of all callers of libvirt's _create_image

Change-Id: Ib9ca0ecd5020c6e75054bf0389f8da96d827d13f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/331116/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We expect _create_image to: # * Download rescue kernel and ramdisk if specified to # (kernel|ramdisk).rescue # * Create the rescue disk as 'disk.rescue' using the rescue image # * Create the config disk if required as disk.config.rescue # We expect _create_image to create all disks, which we can # guarantee don't exist yet. # We expect _create_image to: # * Snapshot the root disk, unless we booted from volume # * Not overwrite disks which already exist # * Including the config disk # * Create any disks which don't exist # * The new flavor may include an ephemeral that the old one # didn't have # * Recreate the swap disk that we explicitly didn't copy in # migrate_disk_and_power_off # * Ensure we have all backing files for qcow2 disks # * Resize all disks if required # * Whether we copied disks or we're on shared storage, existing # disks haven't been resized for a new flavor yet.
deleted_lines: # assume _create_image does nothing if a target file exists. # NOTE: This has the intended side-effect of fetching a missing # backing file. # NOTE(mdbooth): We rely on _create_image to recreate the swap disk # that we explicitly didn't copy in migrate_disk_and_power_off

commit_message:
Move root disk snapshot into finish_migration

_create_image has 3 callers, and this behaviour is only relevant to
one of them. Also, by burying the snapshot in _create_image and
guarding it with task_state, it makes it hard for the reader to see
that finish_migration is doing this. It also makes it hard for the
reader to see that nothing else is doing this.

Change-Id: I3e22b8d48385e08dbb5cae0abdcfdfa9b95c8667

commit_message:
fix CI failure due to oslo.messaging 5.0.0

Recently, oslo.messaging does a refactor [1] which causes
get_notification_listener returns a new type
NotificationServer instead of previous MessageHandlingServer,
they have different attributes, so our test code which relies on
MessageHandlingServer fails in CI gate.

This patch makes test code not rely on oslo.messaging details.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/990d894eaf0d18941b56d89bff2bca51de375640

Conflicts:
	ceilometer/tests/functional/test_notification.py

Change-Id: Id588bb4c22ac819617c87de021cdf580c4e0d0f5
Closes-Bug: #1580930
(cherry picked from commit 23d5c9f648d8352aa205fbe46ba9796a5424874f)

commit_message:
mongodb: update TTL on expirer run

It's counter-intuitive to need to have to call dbsync when changing the value
in the config file, as one expect it to be updated also when running the
expirer. Expirer is the standard way.

Change-Id: I04bee39ee116f58566e1aabbe72e8af09121776a

deleted_lines: from oslo_config import cfg ttl = cfg.CONF.database.event_time_to_live self.update_ttl(ttl, 'event_ttl', 'timestamp', self.db.event) @staticmethod def clear_expired_event_data(ttl): LOG.debug("Clearing expired event data is based on native " "MongoDB time to live feature and going in background.")

revisions:

commit_message:
libvirt: Move config disk creation into a separate function

Change-Id: I8261184ad1cc14383d552865e4ff8de90e75ac09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/333981/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_config_disk(self, instance, rescue=False): """Get the config disk for an instance, or None if it does not require one. :param instance: The instance we are getting the config disk for. :param rescue: True if we are getting the config disk for a rescue instance, otherwise False. :return: A config disk, or None if the instance does not require a config disk. :rtype: imagebackend.Image """ name = 'disk.config' if rescue: name = rescue_name(name) if configdrive.required_by(instance): LOG.info(_LI('Using config drive'), instance=instance) return self.image_backend.by_name( instance, name, self._get_disk_config_image_type()) return None def _create_config_disk(self, config_disk, instance, admin_pass, files, network_info, rescue=False): """Create a config disk. :param config_disk: The config disk we are creating. :param instance: The instance whose config disk we are creating. :param admin_pass: Config info: admin password. :param files: Config info: Files to inject. :param network_info: Config info: network :param rescue: True if this is a config disk for a rescue instance, otherwise False. """ # NOTE(mdbooth): Once we have replaced all the backend implementations # and taught create_from_func to optionally not put things in the # cache, we should replace this entire function with create_from_func. # At that point we can add the creation function to _get_config_disk # above, and this method goes away entirely. name = 'disk.config' if rescue: name = rescue_name(name) extra_md = {} if admin_pass: extra_md['admin_pass'] = admin_pass inst_md = instance_metadata.InstanceMetadata( instance, content=files, extra_md=extra_md, network_info=network_info) cdb = configdrive.ConfigDriveBuilder(instance_md=inst_md) with cdb: instance_path = libvirt_utils.get_instance_path(instance) config_drive_local_path = os.path.join(instance_path, name) LOG.info(_LI('Creating config drive at %(path)s'), {'path': config_drive_local_path}, instance=instance) try: cdb.make_drive(config_drive_local_path) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE('Creating config drive failed ' 'with error: %s'), e, instance=instance) try: config_disk.import_file( instance, config_drive_local_path, name) finally: # NOTE(mikal): if the config drive was imported into RBD, # then we no longer need the local copy if CONF.libvirt.images_type == 'rbd': os.unlink(config_drive_local_path) config_disk = self._get_config_disk(instance, rescue) if config_disk is not None and not config_disk.exists(): self._create_config_disk(config_disk, instance, admin_pass, files, network_info, rescue)
deleted_lines: config_disk = None if configdrive.required_by(instance): LOG.info(_LI('Using config drive'), instance=instance) config_disk = self.image_backend.by_name( instance, 'disk.config' + suffix, self._get_disk_config_image_type()) # Don't overwrite an existing config drive if not config_disk.exists(): extra_md = {} if admin_pass: extra_md['admin_pass'] = admin_pass inst_md = instance_metadata.InstanceMetadata( instance, content=files, extra_md=extra_md, network_info=network_info) cdb = configdrive.ConfigDriveBuilder(instance_md=inst_md) with cdb: config_drive_local_path = self._get_disk_config_path( instance, suffix) LOG.info(_LI('Creating config drive at %(path)s'), {'path': config_drive_local_path}, instance=instance) try: cdb.make_drive(config_drive_local_path) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE('Creating config drive failed ' 'with error: %s'), e, instance=instance) try: config_disk.import_file( instance, config_drive_local_path, 'disk.config' + suffix) finally: # NOTE(mikal): if the config drive was imported into RBD, # then we no longer need the local copy if CONF.libvirt.images_type == 'rbd': os.unlink(config_drive_local_path)

commit_message:
Add the atop service UI settings section

This change adds the appropriate section to UI settings page.
It contains the default settings from the fuel-library and the
note message for an operator.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ie0e69f58183193455d5d036b45668a3476f1a693
Partial-Bug: #1597250
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Replace raw_input with input to make PY3 compatible

The raw_input() raises NameError: name 'raw_input' is not defined in
python3. This patch fixes it by replacing raw_input with input to make
PY3 compatible.

Change-Id: I34d7608215c72d105b31293bfc6d779df47d7631
Closes-Bug: #1595827

commit_message:
tests: clean up designate client session mock on test exit

This test was modifying the driver session method without making an
effort to restore the original value after the test case completion.
This resulted in two consequent tests that relied on the method that
were triggered in the same test thread, to trigger a failure for one of
them.

Changed the setup logic for the test class to use mock.patch(..).start()
instead.

Closes-Bug: #1593647
Change-Id: I08be90691b5417025c40c5a18308d820dc7a43d2

commit_message:
Support deprecated enable_ceph_storage boolean

This was missing in the initial revision of the Ceph modules but we
want to support usage of the old parameter for a cycle.

Change-Id: I7ac096feb9f5655003becd79d2eea355a047c90b

commit_message:
Implement TaaS driver for midonet

This patch provides MidonetTaasDriver based on
the service_driver of Tap-as-a-Service.
MidonetTaasDriver enables users to use TaaS with MidoNet.

Change-Id: I4112915bdd0afa8a234202ca2a13532bd60f220c
Implements: blueprint midonet-tap-as-a-service
Closes-Bug: #1554961
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/71/320871/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2016 Midokura SARL # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from midonet.neutron._i18n import _LE from midonet.neutron.client import base as c_base from neutron_taas.services.taas import service_drivers as taas_service_drivers from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import helpers as log_helpers from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import excutils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class MidonetTaasDriver(taas_service_drivers.TaasBaseDriver): """Midonet Taas Service Driver class""" def __init__(self, service_plugin): LOG.debug("Loading MidonetTaasDriver.") self.client = c_base.load_client(cfg.CONF.MIDONET) super(MidonetTaasDriver, self).__init__(service_plugin) @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_tap_service_precommit(self, context): pass @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_tap_service_postcommit(self, context): try: ts = context.tap_service self.client.create_tap_service(context._plugin_context, ts) except Exception as ex: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to create tap service %(tap_service)s " "in Midonet: %(err)s"), {"tap_service": ts, "err": ex}) @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_tap_service_precommit(self, context): pass @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_tap_service_postcommit(self, context): try: ts = context.tap_service self.client.delete_tap_service(context, ts['id']) except Exception as ex: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to delete a tap service" "%(tap_service)s in Midonet: %(err)s"), {"tap_service": ts['id'], "err": ex}) @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_tap_flow_precommit(self, context): pass @log_helpers.log_method_call def create_tap_flow_postcommit(self, context): try: tf = context.tap_flow self.client.create_tap_flow(context._plugin_context, tf) except Exception as ex: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to create tap flow %(tap_flow)s " "in Midonet: %(err)s"), {"tap_flow": tf, "err": ex}) @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_tap_flow_precommit(self, context): pass @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete_tap_flow_postcommit(self, context): try: tf = context.tap_flow self.client.delete_tap_flow(context._plugin_context, tf['id']) except Exception as ex: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to delete a tap flow" "%(tap_flow)s in Midonet: %(err)s"), {"tap_flow": tf['id'], "err": ex})

Error: /Stage[main]/Sahara::Db::Sync/Exec[sahara-dbmanage]: Could not find command 'sahara-db-manage'

commit_message:
[Mitaka only] Install packages for new components on upgrade

AODH is already installed at the point of controller upgrade script
running, because it has a separate migration step, but Sahara and
Gnocchi aren't installed yet, and it leads to errors during the converge
step:

Error: /Stage[main]/Sahara::Db::Sync/Exec[sahara-dbmanage]: Could not find command 'sahara-db-manage'
Error: /Stage[main]/Gnocchi::Db::Sync/Exec[gnocchi-db-sync]: Could not find command 'gnocchi-upgrade'

Installing those packages makes the converge finish fine.

Change-Id: Iaad51f37c59f8f46436bbb200d469e24457176ed
Closes-Bug: #1597674
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/67/335867/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # install sahara and gnocchi packages yum -y install openstack-gnocchi-api openstack-gnocchi-indexer-sqlalchemy openstack-gnocchi-carbonara openstack-gnocchi-statsd openstack-gnocchi-metricd openstack-sahara openstack-sahara-api openstack-sahara-engine

commit_message:
Add user_domain_name and project_domain_name

- Add user_domain_name and project_domain_name set to 'Default' by
default.
- Change project_domain_id and user_domain_id to be os_service_default.

This change is required with latest Keystone, as we need to specify
domain names to authentificate against Keystone.

Change-Id: Id3debd30aec0c3925c92332afe99fb092c006d1a

commit_message:
Don't create actions when attempting to update one that doesn't exist

The API called create_or_update_action_definition when doing a PUT
request. This was incorrect, as updating an action that doesn't
exist shouldn't create a new action - rather a 404 is expected.

This change adds a new create_or_update_actions method that has
has the previous behaviour and updates the action_manager.py to
use this as it required the old behaviour. The update_actions
method is then updated to use the DB API call that will error if
the action doesn't exist.

Change-Id: Iea9ce71078058224172d31e20d84746052a28b2f
Closes-Bug: 1568541
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/54/331554/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: update_action(def update_action(action_spec, definition, scope): return db_api.update_action_definition(values['name'], values)
deleted_lines: create_or_update_action(def create_or_update_action(action_spec, definition, scope): return db_api.create_or_update_action_definition(values['name'], values)

commit_message:
Add nfs-ganesha to docker container

The change adds nfs-ganesha to the container image. Nfs-ganesha
is compiled with dbus support on. Also some initial container
setup is performed.

commit_message:
Enable configuring of mysql binlogs through charm

This change introduces 'enable-binlogs' and 'binlogs-path' charm
options so that binlogs can be configured through charms. Binlogs
are by default disabled.

Closes-Bug: 1424603
Change-Id: I437170506bbd7013f4884277ff863af2b485046b

commit_message:
Fix snapshot manage Tempest test

In the process of managing a snapshot, drivers may want to
rename the snapshot. This could warrant updating the
provider_location as well.

The tempest tests for snapshot manage should not expect that
the provider location will remain unchanged after the driver
has performed the manage operation.

Change-Id: Ib07ba0c55ef4cb3da8f4ba5b0f9c1d4340c3f0e1
Closes-Bug: #1598287

commit_message:
add pci_devices to anonymous statistic

Nailgun agent collects some anonymous statistic of Fuel usage.
This statistic consists lshw output, but lshw part of report doesn't
send to stat db.
Remove excess copying in get_node_meta function. Now it returns full meta
dict inculding pci_devices dict.
Also added tests for new meta dict params and fixed test env config for
this tests.

Closes-Bug: #1597276

Change-Id: I7273f953250fd5bd96f7603fbe6b3a658ba79950

subject: Allow virtuals during python-setuptools install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 10:17:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest/commit/c51deaf41d213a2aafc2b9a276590ffc29d766ed', 'message': 'Allow virtuals during python-setuptools install

On CentOS7 the python-setuptools package has been obsoleted in favor of
the python2-setuptools package. Attempting to install python-setuptools on
CentOS7 using Puppet results in a package always being installed [1], which
breaks tests which run Puppet twice to check that nothing changes. This is
fixed by providing an allow_virtual parameter [2].

[1] $ sudo puppet apply -t -e 'package {"python-setuptools": ensure =>
installed }'
Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Package[python-setuptools]/ensure: created
$ echo $?
2

$ sudo puppet apply -t -e 'package {"python-setuptools": ensure =>
installed }'
Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Package[python-setuptools]/ensure: created
$ echo $?
2

[2] $ sudo puppet apply -t -e 'package {"python-setuptools": ensure =>
installed, allow_virtual => true }'
Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Package[python-setuptools]/ensure: created
$ echo $?
2

$ sudo puppet apply -t -e 'package {"python-setuptools": ensure =>
installed, allow_virtual => true }'
$ echo $?
0

Change-Id: I50ade953d4c71c9d52214199629ada59f04ea575
(cherry picked from commit ee593e003ff7e1c077f170fb6897111866176684)

the python2-setuptools package. Attempting to install python-setuptools on

commit_message:
Allow virtuals during python-setuptools install

On CentOS7 the python-setuptools package has been obsoleted in favor of
the python2-setuptools package. Attempting to install python-setuptools on
CentOS7 using Puppet results in a package always being installed [1], which
breaks tests which run Puppet twice to check that nothing changes. This is
fixed by providing an allow_virtual parameter [2].

[1] $ sudo puppet apply -t -e 'package {"python-setuptools": ensure =>
installed }'
Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Package[python-setuptools]/ensure: created
$ echo $?
2

$ sudo puppet apply -t -e 'package {"python-setuptools": ensure =>
installed }'
Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Package[python-setuptools]/ensure: created
$ echo $?
2

[2] $ sudo puppet apply -t -e 'package {"python-setuptools": ensure =>
installed, allow_virtual => true }'
Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Package[python-setuptools]/ensure: created
$ echo $?
2

$ sudo puppet apply -t -e 'package {"python-setuptools": ensure =>
installed, allow_virtual => true }'
$ echo $?
0

Backport notice: use allow_virtual only for Puppet 3.6 or higher,
which is minimal version available in current distro versions.

Change-Id: I50ade953d4c71c9d52214199629ada59f04ea575
(cherry picked from commit ee593e003ff7e1c077f170fb6897111866176684)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest refs/changes/18/335918/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ], { allow_virtual => true })

commit_message:
Added geneve type_driver config options

Geneve type driver uses the vni_ranges and a new parameter
called max_header_size.

Change-Id: I968762e6078ab8ee4e073ac99527ddde6cc96bdc
(cherry picked from commit 4731f243ea5c856d348a07aef63ce4577e2dc63e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/69/336869/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to ['local', 'flat', 'vlan', 'gre', 'vxlan', 'geneve'].# [*max_header_size*] # (optional) Geneve encapsulation header size is dynamic, this value is used to calculate # the maximum MTU for the driver. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $max_header_size = $::os_service_default, max_header_size => $max_header_size

subject: Dump and restore galera db during major upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-03 10:20:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/25c0ed9d13ce4f101f08a70409d86c30fc8ddd41', 'message': '[WIP] Initial work to dump and restore galera db

When the overcloud is upgraded we do a yum update of the packages.
This step might introduce a newer galera version. In such a situation
we need to dump the db and restore it. The high-level workflow should
be the following:
1) During the main upgrade step, before shutting down the cluster
   we need to dump the db
2) We upgrade the packages
3) We briefly start mysql on a single node while making sure that
   /root/.my.cnf is briefly moved out of the way (because it contains
   a password) and import the data. After the import we shutdown this
   mysql instance
4) We let the cluster start up normally

We would like these steps to happen in the following situation:
A) Given a locally installed mariadb version X.Y, we want a dump
   restore happen when the newer to-be-installed mariadb version
   has any higher values for X or Y.

B) We would like to add a parameter where we can suppress this behaviour
   something like a parameter "DoNotDumpRestoreDB", which is normally set
   to false. When set to true, we won't do the dump even when the
   conditions in A) are met.

Once this is in shape we will need to backport it to mitaka as well.

Currently this is just a quick WIP which made the dump and restore
process work in our tests. The main TODO atm is the following:
- Make the script more robust and have it check the space on the
  partition where we dump the db.
- Add some reasonably high timeouts for the dump and import to complete
- Add A) and B) logic above
- Add some logic to remove the old dumps and saved directories
- Make everything idempotent

Fixes: 1587449

Change-Id: I374628547aed091129d0deaa29764bfc998d76ea

'}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2016-06-22 16:22:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/08915592fd437c20e5d4bb9b6fe981bf46020512', 'message': "Dump and restore galera db during major upgrades

When the overcloud is upgraded we do a yum update of the packages.
This step might introduce a newer galera version. In such a situation
we need to dump the db and restore it. The high-level workflow should
be the following:
1) During the main upgrade step, before shutting down the cluster
   we need to dump the db
2) We upgrade the packages
3) We briefly start mysql on a single node while making sure that
   /root/.my.cnf is briefly moved out of the way (because it contains
   a password) and import the data. After the import we shutdown this
   mysql instance
4) We let the cluster start up normally

The above steps will take place in the following scenarios.
Given a locally installed mariadb version X.Y.Z and release R,
we will dump and restore the DB under the following conditions:
A) MySqlMajorUpgrade template parameter is set to 'auto' and
   the upgraded package differs in X, Y *or* Z. We basically don't
   dump automatically if the release field changes.

B) MySqlMajorUpgrade template parameter is set to 'yes'

When MySqlMajorUpgrade is set to 'no', no dumping will be performed.
Note that this will give a non functional upgrade if a major mariadb
upgrade is taking place.

We also fix a wrong keystone path with crudini that was observed
during upgrades.

Partial-Bug: #1587449

Co-Author: Damien Ciabrin <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Author: Mike Bayer <mbayer@redhat.com>

Depends-On: If85672afa8a92de2a1c0a222d28682fd100bcf7d
Depends-On: I8cb4cb3193e6b823aad48ad7dbbbb227364d2a58

Change-Id: I374628547aed091129d0deaa29764bfc998d76ea

"}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2016-06-23 10:11:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/34a30ba53b29872616cca26329f421c828e700fb', 'message': "Dump and restore galera db during major upgrades

When the overcloud is upgraded we do a yum update of the packages.
This step might introduce a newer galera version. In such a situation
we need to dump the db and restore it. The high-level workflow should
be the following:
1) During the main upgrade step, before shutting down the cluster
   we need to dump the db
2) We upgrade the packages
3) We briefly start mysql on a single node while making sure that
   /root/.my.cnf is briefly moved out of the way (because it contains
   a password) and import the data. After the import we shutdown this
   mysql instance
4) We let the cluster start up normally

The above steps will take place in the following scenarios.
Given a locally installed mariadb version X.Y.Z and release R,
we will dump and restore the DB under the following conditions:
A) MySqlMajorUpgrade template parameter is set to 'auto' and
   the upgraded package differs in X, Y *or* Z. We basically don't
   dump automatically if the release field changes.

B) MySqlMajorUpgrade template parameter is set to 'yes'

When MySqlMajorUpgrade is set to 'no', no dumping will be performed.
Note that this will give a non functional upgrade if a major mariadb
upgrade is taking place.

We also fix a wrong keystone path with crudini that was observed
during upgrades.

commit_message:
Dump and restore galera db during major upgrades

When the overcloud is upgraded we do a yum update of the packages.
This step might introduce a newer galera version. In such a situation
we need to dump the db and restore it. The high-level workflow should
be the following:
1) During the main upgrade step, before shutting down the cluster
   we need to dump the db
2) We upgrade the packages
3) We briefly start mysql on a single node while making sure that
   /root/.my.cnf is briefly moved out of the way (because it contains
   a password) and import the data. After the import we shutdown this
   mysql instance
4) We let the cluster start up normally

The above steps will take place in the following scenarios.
Given a locally installed mariadb version X.Y.Z and release R,
we will dump and restore the DB under the following conditions:
A) MySqlMajorUpgrade template parameter is set to 'auto' and
   the upgraded package differs in X, Y *or* Z. We basically don't
   dump automatically if the release field changes.

B) MySqlMajorUpgrade template parameter is set to 'yes'

When MySqlMajorUpgrade is set to 'no', no dumping will be performed.
Note that this will give a non functional upgrade if a major mariadb
upgrade is taking place.

Partial-Bug: #1587449

Co-Author: Damien Ciabrin <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Author: Mike Bayer <mbayer@redhat.com>

Depends-On: I8cb4cb3193e6b823aad48ad7dbbbb227364d2a58
Depends-On: I38dcacfabc44539aab1f7da85168fe44a1b43a51

Change-Id: I374628547aed091129d0deaa29764bfc998d76ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/05/325205/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: GALERA_BACKUP_DIR=/var/tmp/mysql_upgrade_osp # FIXME: we need to find out if this is part of the mariadb 5->10 upgrade # FIXME: we'd probably want a way to make sure we do not fill the space and # break things maybe checking current size and mkaing sure we have doulbe # that free plus a bit (actually three times, since we move the dir) mkdir $GALERA_BACKUP_DIR mysqldump --defaults-extra-file=/root/.my.cnf -u root --flush-privileges --all-databases --single-transaction > "$GALERA_BACKUP_DIR/openstack_database.sql" cp -rdp /etc/my.cnf* $GALERA_BACKUP_DIR # FIXME: we will need some logic to do better here if [ -d /var/lib/mysql-backup-saved ]; then echo_error "ERROR: galera backup dir already exist" exit 1 fi # We want the old directory moved away on every controller mv /var/lib/mysql /var/lib/mysql-backup-saved cat >> /etc/my.cnf.d/galera.cnf <<EOF [mysqld] wsrep_on = ON wsrep_cluster_address = gcomm://localhost EOF if [ "$(hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml bootstrap_nodeid)" = "$(facter hostname)" ]; then # Scripts run via heat have no HOME variable set and this confuses mysqladmin export HOME=/root/ mkdir /var/lib/mysql || /bin/true chown mysql:mysql /var/lib/mysql chmod 0755 /var/lib/mysql restorecon -R /var/lib/mysql/ mysql_install_db --datadir=/var/lib/mysql --user=mysql chown -R mysql:mysql /var/lib/mysql/ mysqld_safe --wsrep-new-cluster & # We have a populated /root/.my.cnf with root/password here so we need to temporarily rename it # because the newly created db is empty mv /root/.my.cnf /root/.my.cnf.temporary timeout 60 sh -c 'while ! mysql -e "" &> /dev/null; do sleep 1; done' mysql -u root < "$GALERA_BACKUP_DIR/openstack_database.sql" mv /root/.my.cnf.temporary /root/.my.cnf mysqladmin -u root shutdown fi

commit_message:
Update Expiration Policy Documentation

This change re-writes the section covering the expiration policy to explain it
in more detail and also include the required evaluation_interval setting which
was previously undocumented.

Change-Id: Ib7f4e8ccf4c15cc6e22472b28004d0a9ad34497f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/80/336580/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: When Mistral is used in production it can be difficult to control the number of completed workflow executions. By default Mistral will store all executions indefinitely and over time the number stored will accumulate. This can be resolved by setting an expiration policy.When enabled, the policy will define a maximum age of an execution in minutes since the last updated time. To enable and set a policy, edit the Mistral configuration file and specify ``older_than`` and ``evaluation_interval`` in minutes. .. code-block:: cfg older_than = 10080 # 1 week evaluation_interval = 120 # 2 hours For the expiration policy to be enabled, both of these configuration options must be set. - **older_than** This defines the maximum age of an execution in minutes since it was last updated. It must be greater or equal to ``1``. - **evaluation_interval** The evaluation interval defines how frequently Mistral will check and expire old executions. In the above example it is set to two hours, then every two hours Mistral will clean up and look for expired executions.
deleted_lines: For Mistral used in production, it is often hardly to control the number of workflow executions. The number of workflow executions is significantly growing for the long time of Mistral running. The purpose of this feature to delete old workflow executions which has been already completed. The criteria is the time when a workflow execution was updated last time.In order to configure this feature, please open and edit configuration file and specify time in minutes:: older_than = 10080 # Workflow executions older than 1 week will be deleted automatically.

commit_message:
Replace reference to cinder:: parameter with nova:: parameter

Changes a reference to a cinder:: parameter into the nova compute
class to a nova:: parameter, which makes sure we're not trying
to access "out of bound" parameters.

Change-Id: I871ef420700e6d0ee5c1e444e019d58b3a9a45a6

subject: Provide generic capabilities for support matrix
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 16:47:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/ext/feature_matrix.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f6da07d9e6f288c934f200f52e2f21a6adb5c437', 'message': 'Provide generic capabilities for support matrix

Many features used in the NFV or HPC use cases have underlying hardware
or software requirements outside of a given platform and hypervisor
support. There must be some way to represent these requirements in the
configuration files. Do this by way of a capabilities section, in which
the specific feature required of each device type can be detailed. For
example:

    [capability.net.sriov]
    title=SR-IOV
    description=SR-IOV is a network interface that allows for the
      isolation of the PCI Express resources for manageability and
      performance reasons.

    [capability.cpu.iommu]
    title=IOMMU
    description=IOMMU is a system specific IO mapping mechanism and can
    be used with most devices

These capabilities can then be expressed as requirements for any given

    ...

blueprint feature-classification

Change-Id: Ib532c380adc3e3b1f957e74ec78f8fdc570afeb4
'}]
commit_message:
Provide generic capabilities for support matrix

Many features used in the NFV or HPC use cases have underlying hardware
or software requirements outside of a given platform and hypervisor
support. There must be some way to represent these requirements in the
configuration files. Do this by way of a capabilities section, in which
the specific feature required of each device type can be detailed. For
example:

    [capability.net.sriov]
    title=SR-IOV
    description=SR-IOV is a network interface that allows for the
      isolation of the PCI Express resources for manageability and
      performance reasons.

    [capability.cpu.iommu]
    title=IOMMU
    description=IOMMU is a system specific IO mapping mechanism and can
    be used with most devices

These capabilities can then be expressed as requirements for any given
feature. For example:

    [operation.attach-sriov]
    title=Attach SR-IOV NIC
    ...
    requirements=net.sriov,cpu.iommu

blueprint feature-classification

Change-Id: Ib532c380adc3e3b1f957e74ec78f8fdc570afeb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/327240/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Dict of (name, MatrixCapability) enumerating all of the hardware # capabilities that have been identified as requirements for the given # feature. The 'name' dict key is the combined value of the 'device' # and 'feature' attributes of MatrixCapability self.capabilities = {} notes=None, cli=None, maturity=None, requirements=None, if requirements is None: requirements = {} # Dict of (name, MatrixCapability) enumerating all of the hardware # requirements that have been identified as requirements for the given # feature. The 'name' dict key is the combined value of the 'device' # and 'feature' attributes of MatrixHardwareFeature self.requirements = requirementsclass MatrixCapability(object): """Representation of a hardware capability. Some features require specific hardware features. These requirements must be highlighted to ensure correct hardware is used for deployment. """ def __init__(self, device, feature, title, description=None): """:param device: Unique identifier for type of device :param feature: Unique identifier for feature of device :param title: Human friendly name of the hardware feature :param description (optional): Brief overview of the feature """ self.device = device self.feature = feature self.title = title self.description = description matrix.capabilities = self._get_capabilities(cfg) matrix.features = self._get_features(cfg, matrix.targets, matrix.capabities) def _get_capabilities(self, cfg): """Retrieve all special capabilities detailed.""" prefix = "capability." capabilities = {} for section in cfg.sections(): if not section.startswith(prefix): continue key = section.lstrip(prefix) if len(_key.split(".")) != 2: raise Exception( "section name for '[%s]' section must be of format " "'DEVICE.FEATURE'" % section) device, feature = _key.split(".") title = cfg.get(section, "title") description = cfg.get(section, "description") capability = MatrixCapability(device, feature, title, description) capabilities[key] = capability return capabilities prefix = "target." if not section.startswith(prefix): key = section.lstrip(prefix) def _get_features(self, cfg, targets, capabilities): requirements = {} if cfg.has_option(section, "requirements"): requirements_ = cfg.get(section, "requirements").split(',') for requirement in requirements_: if requirement not in capabilities: raise Exception( "'requirement' field value '%s' in ['%s'] " "section must be defined in the ['capabilities'] " "section" % (requirement, section)) requirements[requirement] = capabilities[requirement] title, notes, cli, maturity, requirements, api_doc_link, admin_doc_link, tempest_test_uuids)
deleted_lines: notes=None, cli=None, maturity=None, matrix.features = self._get_features(cfg, matrix.targets) if not section.startswith("target."): key = section[7:] def _get_features(self, cfg, targets): title, notes, cli, maturity, api_doc_link, admin_doc_link, tempest_test_uuids)

commit_message:
Fix duplicated and missed flow in l2 l3 app

We keep l3_app to send subnet gw arp responder flow
instead of l2_app to avoid sending the flow twice.
We also let l3_app to send l2 goto l3 flow instead
of l2-app to avoid the flow miss.

Change-Id: I5ae491c10009ab50a427fef0c6da8b6fc68cf42e
Closes-bug: #1592223
Closes-bug: #1593577

Library repository: https://github.com/docopt/docopt
This dependency is required by openstack/monasca_analytics.

 1. Is the library actively maintained?

    Yes

 2. Is the library good code?

    Yes

 3. Is the library license compatible?

    Yes, MIT

 4. Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
    latest / Fedora latest) ?

    Yes (Ubuntu: python-docopt, Fedora: pyhton-docopt)

 5. Is the function of this library covered by other libraries?

    Partially: argparse is such an example. The main difference is
    that docopt parse a doc string and generate an argument parser
    from that. The benefits are:

     - Readability
     - Verified user provided usage string (in argparse, only generated
       one is verified for correctness)
     - Commands (sub parsers in argparse) are trivial to write

    There are many port of docopt in other languages than python that
    are also quite popular. It means that adding docopt would more
    likely improve new contributors experience in openstack projects
    that use it.

 6. Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev
    or infrastructure setup? Which?

    openstack/monasca-analytics

Change-Id: Ib276746687ebbd892ae5b1f95a24f8a30b3466ae
'}]
commit_message:
Add docopt, a library for doc usage and argument parsing.

Library repository: https://github.com/docopt/docopt
This dependency is required by openstack/monasca_analytics.

 1. Is the library actively maintained?

    Yes

 2. Is the library good code?

    Yes

 3. Is the library license compatible?

    Yes, MIT

 4. Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
    latest / Fedora latest) ?

    Yes (Ubuntu: python-docopt, Fedora: pyhton-docopt)

 5. Is the function of this library covered by other libraries?

    Partially: argparse is such an example. The main difference is
    that docopt parse a doc string and generate an argument parser
    from that. The benefits are:

     - Readability
     - Verified user provided usage string (in argparse, only generated
       one is verified for correctness)
     - Commands (sub parsers in argparse) are trivial to write

    There are many port of docopt in other languages than python that
    are also quite popular. It means that adding docopt would more
    likely improve new contributors experience in openstack projects
    that use it.

 6. Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev
    or infrastructure setup? Which?

    openstack/monasca-analytics

Change-Id: Ib276746687ebbd892ae5b1f95a24f8a30b3466ae

Check ``agent`` and ``agent_scheduler`` are included in the output.Demo setup ~~~~~~~~~~ * - OpenStack controller host - controlnode dhcp_agents_per_network = 1 .. note:: In the above configuration, we use ``dhcp_agents_per_network = 1`` for this demonstration. In usual deployments, we suggest setting ``dhcp_agents_per_network`` to more than one to match the number of DHCP agents in your deployment. See :ref:`conf-dhcp-agents-per-network`.Prerequisites for demonstration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Admin role is required to use the agent management and scheduler extensions. deployment ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Every agent that supports these extensions will register itself with the neutron server when it starts up. 2013-03-16T01:16:18.000000 | | description | | | heartbeat_timestamp | 2013-03-17T01:37:22.000000 | | host | HostA | | id | 58f4ce07-6789-4bb3-aa42-ed3779db2b03 | | started_at | 2013-03-16T06:48:39.000000 | | topic | dhcp_agent | +---------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+Managing assignment of networks to DHCP agent ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ A single network can be assigned to more than one DHCP agents and one DHCP agent can host more than one network. You can add a network to a DHCP agent and remove one from it. When you create a network with one port, the network will be scheduled to an active DHCP agent. If many active DHCP agents are running, select oneHA of DHCP agents ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Boot a VM on ``net2``. Let both DHCP agents host ``net2``. Fail the agents#. Boot a VM on ``net2``: +--------------------------------------+------+--------------------------------------------------+ | id | name | subnets | +--------------------------------------+------+--------------------------------------------------+ | 89dca1c6-c7d4-4f7a-b730-549af0fb6e34 | net1 | f6c832e3-9968-46fd-8e45-d5cf646db9d1 10.0.1.0/24 | | 9b96b14f-71b8-4918-90aa-c5d705606b1a | net2 | 6979b71a-0ae8-448c-aa87-65f68eedcaaa 9.0.1.0/24 | +--------------------------------------+------+--------------------------------------------------+ ... +--------------------------------------+-----------+--------+---------------+ | ID | Name | Status | Networks | +--------------------------------------+-----------+--------+---------------+ | c394fcd0-0baa-43ae-a793-201815c3e8ce | myserver1 | ACTIVE | net1=10.0.1.3 | | 2d604e05-9a6c-4ddb-9082-8a1fbdcc797d | myserver2 | ACTIVE | net1=10.0.1.4 | | c7c0481c-3db8-4d7a-a948-60ce8211d585 | myserver3 | ACTIVE | net1=10.0.1.5 | | f62f4731-5591-46b1-9d74-f0c901de567f | myserver4 | ACTIVE | net2=9.0.1.2 | +--------------------------------------+-----------+--------+---------------+To test the HA of DHCP agent:Disabling and removing an agent ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~the agent. After the agent is disabled, you can safely remove the agent. Even after disabling the agent, resources on the agent are kept assigned. Ensure you remove the resources on the agent before you delete the agent. Disable the DHCP agent on HostA before you stop it: $ neutron agent-update a0c1c21c-d4f4-4577-9ec7-908f2d48622d --admin-state-up FalseAfter you stop the DHCP agent on HostA, you can delete it by the following command: .. _conf-dhcp-agents-per-network: Enabling DHCP high availability by default ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ You can control the default number of DHCP agents assigned to a network by setting the following configuration option in the file ``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf``. .. code-block:: ini dhcp_agents_per_network = 3

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-27 10:35:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/storlets/commit/ef972c69cccb724bd490aec22bab55aa5419561f', 'message': 'Refactoring SBusDatagram

The SBus datagram is a serialization and de-serialization object that
is written both on python and in java. It serializes commands that go
from the middleware on the host side or the factory (client) to the
docker container (server). As such it has two logical components:
ClientSBusOutDatagram and ServerSBudInDatagram. In the past we also had
commands going in the opposite direction which required:
ServerSBusOutDatagram and ClientSBusInDatagram

The current implementation had all logical parts in the same object
which made it very difficult to maintain. some fields were set and other not
depending on the usage (in cient or in server), and the accessors were a mess.

This patch introduces independent classes for:
ClientSBusOutDatagram - used by the middleware to send commands to the
daemon_factory and the storlet daemons. We give python implementation.
ServerSBudInDatagram - used by the daemon_factory and storlet daemons
to parse the messages creasted by the ClientSBusOutDatagram. As such
we have both a python and java implementations.

While doing the refactoring style and liscense headers were cleaned up.
Also, all serialized data (except fds) are strings, which make various
conversions done before to be redundant. Overall there is less code
and is much simpler.

Bonus 1: Initial work to be able to see logs of the storlet daemons.
this was missing for a long time now. Currently one has to do:
docker exec -it <container id> /bash/bin and see /var/log/SDaemon.log
this needs to be further improved. Ideally we could take a file descriptor
given by the host and build a log4j on top of it. Partr of the work
was to move the logback.xml installation from the generic java image to the
storlet image as it is storlets related.

Bonus 2: fixes to the deploy_container_engine role. There are still problems
and for the script to work the previous container must be deleted.

Change-Id: Ide59797f451e238b1c424f5ee811d5f1eca616b7

commit_message:
Refactoring SBusDatagram

The SBus datagram is a serialization and de-serialization object that
is written both on python and in java. It serializes commands that go
from the middleware on the host side or the factory (client) to the
docker container (server). As such it has two logical components:
ClientSBusOutDatagram and ServerSBudInDatagram. In the past we also had
commands going in the opposite direction which required:
ServerSBusOutDatagram and ClientSBusInDatagram

The current implementation had all logical parts in the same object
which made it very difficult to maintain. some fields were set and other not
depending on the usage (in cient or in server), and the accessors were a mess.

This patch introduces independent classes for:
ClientSBusOutDatagram - used by the middleware to send commands to the
daemon_factory and the storlet daemons. We give python implementation.
ServerSBudInDatagram - used by the daemon_factory and storlet daemons
to parse the messages creasted by the ClientSBusOutDatagram. As such
we have both a python and java implementations.

While doing the refactoring style and liscense headers were cleaned up.
Also, all serialized data (except fds) are strings, which make various
conversions done before to be redundant. Overall there is less code
and is much simpler.

Bonus 1: Initial work to be able to see logs of the storlet daemons.
this was missing for a long time now. Currently one has to do:
docker exec -it <container id> /bash/bin and see /var/log/SDaemon.log
this needs to be further improved. Ideally we could take a file descriptor
given by the host and build a log4j on top of it. Partr of the work
was to move the logback.xml installation from the generic java image to the
storlet image as it is storlets related.

Bonus 2: fixes to the deploy_container_engine role. There are still problems
and for the script to work the previous container must be deleted.

Change-Id: Ide59797f451e238b1c424f5ee811d5f1eca616b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/06/334406/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[network] Improve neutron purge

This patch makes additions to the neutron purge page to clarify
that the command can be used with tenants that have been deleted
or otherwise do not exist in keystone.

It also documents the expected output when no supported resources
are found.

backport: mitaka
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1580440
Change-Id: I562eb081630e124d690c27ae16d13f9793c5cafe
(cherry picked from commit 37677ff861de75f78ecdf752a6931e13a44ee537)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/16/336816/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The Networking service provides a purge mechanism to delete the following network resources for a project (tenant):* Router interfaces* Floating IP addresses * Security groups Typically, one uses this mechanism to delete networking resources for a defunct project regardless of its existence in the Identity service.#. Source the necessary project credentials. The administrative project can delete resources for all other projects. A regular project can delete its own network resources and those belonging to other projects for which it has sufficient access. #. Delete the network resources for a particular project. .. code-block:: console $ neutron purge PROJECT_ID Replace ``PROJECT_ID`` with the project (tenant) ID. The command provides output that includes a completion percentage and the quantity of successful or unsuccessful network resource deletions. An unsuccessful deletion usually indicates sharing of a resource with one or more additional projects. Purging resources: 100% complete. Deleted 1 security_group, 2 ports, 1 router, 1 floatingip, 2 networks. The following resources could not be deleted: 1 network. The command also indicates if a project lacks network resources. Tenant has no supported resources.
deleted_lines: From the Mitaka release onwards, the OpenStack Networking command-line interface (CLI) supports the deletion of multiple resources for a given tenant with a single command. The resources currently supported by this feature are:* Router Interfaces* Floating IPs * Security GroupsTo delete all supported resources owned by a tenant, use the :command:`neutron purge` command as follows: $ neutron purge <tenant_id> An admin can provide the ID of any tenant that they have access to. A tenant must provide their own ID. While the command is running, feedback is provided in the form of completion percentage. On completion, the command returns a list of resources that were and/or could not be deleted: Purging resources: 100% complete. Deleted 1 security_group, 2 ports, 1 router, 1 floatingip, 2 networks. The following resouces could not be deleted: 1 network. A resource in use by another tenant, for example, a shared network with ports in more than one tenant, will prevent it from being deleted.

specified in requirements.txt.

commit_message:
Correct test_list_servers_by_limits_greater_than_actual_count failure

When there are some other testcases running at same time,
test_list_servers_by_limits_greater_than_actual_count may fail because
other testcases may create servers using same tenant.
This is to force test_list_servers_by_limits_greater_than_
actual_count to always use newly created tenant to avoid this.

Change-Id: Ic6a1ab64e27b71de9d8ddc2cbed5d180b981e57a
Closes-Bug: #1587775

commit_message:
Delete previous template upon update

During stack update, we flip the stack raw_template a number of times.
In case of success, we leave the old active raw_template row unlinked to
anything, so it needs to be deleted. This patch does so.

Change-Id: I6f3ff5bfbac417e3bd6032cabfbc00bd6dec8b02
Closes-Bug: #1506077
(cherry picked from commit 117e5a0e654111de3f28900228d858cd0683cb1f)

commit_message:
Add Rabbit/epmd port to firewall

This commit adds the epmd port 4369 to the firewall configuration for
the service rabbit. This is necessary for having HA setups working,
since without this port the rabbitmq cloned resource starts only on one
node and the others are not able to complete the rabbit cluster
creation.

Change-Id: Iae042dd60a578e158b75539dc3998fc40185b343

subject: Increase cluster sync timeout for M->N major upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 09:23:53.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/f26a2ed0778ecce7e404c4df9eeb3566719292ab', 'message': 'Increase cluster sync timeout for M->N major upgrades

Since the Liberty release, the number of services managed by pacemaker
on HA Overcloud has increased. This has an impact on
major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh, where cluster sync timeout
value tuned for older releases is now becoming too low.

Raise the cluster sync timeout value to a sensible limit to
give pacemaker enough time to stop the cluster during major upgrade.

Change-Id: I821d354ba30ce39134982ba12a82c429faa3ce62
Closes-Bug: #1597506
(cherry picked from commit 017334bbb5978ed9a9c06f4595506612287c1b14)

commit_message:
Increase cluster sync timeout for M->N major upgrades

Since the Liberty release, the number of services managed by pacemaker
on HA Overcloud has increased. This has an impact on
major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh, where cluster sync timeout
value tuned for older releases is now becoming too low.

Raise the cluster sync timeout value to a sensible limit to
give pacemaker enough time to stop the cluster during major upgrade.

Change-Id: I821d354ba30ce39134982ba12a82c429faa3ce62
Closes-Bug: #1597506
(cherry picked from commit 017334bbb5978ed9a9c06f4595506612287c1b14)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/76/335876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cluster_sync_timeout=1800

commit_message:
Configure correct host_ip for rabbitmq_ocf

This commit fix forgotten change in the rabbitmq_ocf during pinning
puppetlabs-rabbitmq to 5.4.0 [0]. The host_ip value should be set to
the service ip address instead of the management ip address which
used only for management plugin. The appropriate comment about the
node_ip_address setting added. Also, this commit contains some
puppet cleanups and fixes noop tests.

[0] Ic589f5b0e978a3884d80f0fbcbdafc1e62f6c843

Change-Id: I0cd511c8822f8569e3f2892cc04d7c0ca5660ada
Closes-Bug: #1592842
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
